I love the predictive keyboard, which to me is similar to my iPad minis, because I can make a lot of mistakes typing quickly. I enjoy the app selection. It is much much more than my nook color ever offered. I am a medical professional and must have epocrates installed on my device. It was right there for free in the app store and works beautifully on this device. I like the fact that if Amazon's store does not have any app I want, I can sideload it. I have only had my HDX for a few days, however, and have not found any apps to be missing thus far. So I have  not had to sideload anything yet. I hear it is not that difficult. The screen is also great and very hi def. I am not sure if it outranks my iPad though. They seem similar to me. I like how quickly the HDX loads movies,videos, and games without lag or having to reload.Cons: the ads you have to pay $15 to get rid of (but I sometimes enjoy seeing what they're offering. It prompts me to look at books I may have not consideredd before). The fact that you can't change the background of the screens home to anything you want. The poor quality front facing only camera on it. If you take the time to put a camera, why not make give it a front and rear with more megapixels to really compete with other tablets?

Reviews.Title: Technical problems (old age)
Reviews.Author: rolland r smith
Reviews.Content: I love my old Kindle, it is very easy to use however, I am an elderly gentleman and find the new one a little complicated for me. Still do not have a handle on it so need to contact your help desk for answers. If I a can work out the details, I would probably change my rating.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet.
Reviews.Author: Damar Earl
Reviews.Content: My favorite purchase in a long time.  I love it.  A reasonable priced tablet.  I can watch videos on it, read books, play games... it works fast.  Did I say I love it? LOL  I had to use the "call for help" button once... and they really did help!  It was actually kind of fun!

Reviews.Title: GREAT PURCHASE
Reviews.Author: Kathy of Ireland,
Reviews.Content: I have had my kindle HDX for a month now and I have never been so happy with an item it is so much better than my computer is. I love games and this kindle is the way to go.Thank youAmazon

Reviews.Title: If you ever consider having a Tablet that will be your patner wherever you go, This is the one
Reviews.Author: Fredwash
Reviews.Content: My first kindle version was, a paper white version, i own it for quite sometime, and let me confess i was a bit reluctant to upgrading from a "dedicated e book reader" to tablet kind, but i decided to give it a short, after reading some positive review from other user, i wasn't expect anything astonishing or different from the other "considered low-budget " tablets,but guess what the HDX gave me more than i could wish for, and i am located in EAST AFRICA, thousands miles away from US and i am telling you it doesn't matter which corner of the world you are habituated, having this will bring the world into your palms of your hands in so many ways , from the state of the art customer care of its kind, "the may day button"  the life span of battery to the high resolution screen, and finally the sensational quality of "Dolby sound audio".with this gadget you can read, you can listen you can watch, you can even gaming for hours without getting tired of it, Amazon finally did it, and i hope they wont wont release anything as good as this for at least couple of years to come, so i wont have to replace it, hahahaha! because I WILL. i only gave it 4 start because AMAZON don't have a 4G version of HDX available outside of us and Canada, specifically AFRICA, i wish they will release a unlocked  version of Kindle hdx 4G

Reviews.Title: Husband loves his new Kindle
Reviews.Author: Gale
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle Fire HDX7 for my husband to take with him on a trip to Nigeria. He loves it and used it for reading on the very long flights and e-mail to communicate with us at home. Screen is wonderful, bright and fast. Much nicer than just a phone. I would highly recommend this to anyone.  He loves his Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Great present
Reviews.Author: Chris J. York
Reviews.Content: Made for a great present last Christmas, and I must say I was a little jealous of the friend I bought it for because it's a nicer Tablet than my Nook HD+

Reviews.Title: magnificent
Reviews.Author: chingon
Reviews.Content: I bought this from a neighbor who received it as a gift and wanted an iPad. I'd done research and gave it a shot.It is pound for pound the best tablet on the market. I've used other tablets including iPads. The fire HDX is extremely lightweight, easy to use, the screen is AWESOME, it also feels great in my hands. My neighbor has huge buyer's remorse after having spent so much on her iPad.  A small percentage of people would be better off with an iPad.IPad is good. Fire HDX is good and smart.

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: Thomas E. Miller
Reviews.Content: I had purchased a kindle two years ago, for my girlfriend. As she is addicted to it. I would recommend this item to a man needing a present for a anniversary. The new HDX is much faster and a worth while upgrade.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size and weight
Reviews.Author: debra l gilmore
Reviews.Content: OK so to be honest I only bought this Kindle to use with the free books I get for using Amazon Prime ( which is well worth the money by the way). I already have a Nook and an IPad. However, this Kindle has proven to be my favorite electronic devise! It is not as bulky or heavy as my IPad nor does it weigh as much as my Nook. It's speed is much faster than either. I like the lay out of the pages better also. It is very user friendly. I rarely pick up the other two anymore.

Reviews.Title: Great for the whole family!
Reviews.Author: Carl Ward "Black Sinow"
Reviews.Content: When I ordered my Kindle Fire HDX 7, I was like a good deal of you I imagine. I was unsure, wondering if the reported flaws were consistant throughout it's lifespan. But I will say now that I've had a chance to play around with it, it really is an incredible piece of technology, especially for people who are new to tablets and want to get their feet wet.As the case with the Kindle Fire HD, the HDX has a forked variation of android. This means that they are slower to update and their choice of apps will be limited. But this doesn't really mean that it's a terrible downside, especially since you have more access to amazon features, something that most android tablets do not provide enough of. The user interface itself is fairly easy to navigate, but limited in customization due to it's OS being heavily modified by amazon. As mentioned previously, if you are new to tablets, you can't go wrong with the HDX, in either of it's models. If you aren't used to technology in general, then this tablet will be perfect for you. It teaches you how to operate the tablet, which swipes do what and so forth. If that doesn't convince you, then the new mayday might do the job. When you press this button, you can communicate with a member of amazon's technical support team who can temporarily take control of your tablet to show you how to get from point a to point b. The difference between stock android and the modified android OS (aka Fire OS 3.0 as amazon calls it) are obvious, starting with the carousel. The carousel itself is a tray of apps and media that you use or prefer to use the most. Though I do love it, my only complaint is that I wish I could modify what gets added to it, so I could have more control over it. Below the carousel are your installed apps, which I absolutely adore, especially since stock android forces you into multi-home screen configuration (which I hate).The choice of apps may be few, but the selection of media is massive to say the least. If you live in north america, then you may know from experience that some videos, books, and music simply aren't available in the google play store. I have to be honest though, I never really did care much for google play's selection of apps, so having a limited selection really isn't that bad. Amazon offers a free app of the day though, so whatever app that is offered for free may vary from a free to paid variation. So downloading it will mean that you will have that app forever if you snag it. So the answer to the question "what do you get out of the amazon ecosystem?" is this, their entire cache of media, which is nearly perfect. Some movies and episodes might only be available for rent, but that is still more then what you get with google play. Let's be honest here, when you are buying a tablet, you aren't buying it for what isn't available in another person, but what is available to you. With amazon's x-ray, any x-ray enabled song gives you access to it's lyrics. X-Ray enabled movies and television episodes give you access to which actors play what and things of that sort, allowing you to find out who that one actor is through the help of IMDB. Books give you access to characters and which parts of the story they might show up in and so on. Keep inmind that while HD, HDX and paperwhite owners will find themselves enjoying x-ray, non-amazon tablets do not have this feature. If you have prime, then you will find yourself with the option to download prime-enabled movies and episodes. Having access to prime's library really is something to write home about, especially if you can't stand netflix. I have yet to fully test out the prime-enabled features, but I can safely say that prime owners will LOVE the HDX. The downside to this is that you can only download a handful of their videos (in my experience). But never the less, instant video is still a worthwhile feature to consider for prime members.If you have access to children of any sort (be they through babysitting or your own grandchildren), then freetime will be the answer to some of your problems. You can grant them special limited access to the tablet, which can be very helpful I'd imagine. But considering that I don't have kids nor do I babysit, I wouldn't know. So this is strictly up to you in how you prefer freetime. Playing a song, reading an e-book, or watching a movie is what the HDX is designed for. It offers incredible HD-quality graphics and stunning audio to make your experiences enjoyable. With specifications that are equal to what the nexus 7 offers and considering that there is a 64gb varient (which I own), it is the perfect media-consumption tablet to bring with you on vacation.If you use the internet frequently enough, then you will have nothing to fear! The HDX has a decent email client and web browser (aka silk). Silk is comparable to the stock android browser and should you not want to use the various side-loaded youtube apps, you can still access youtube via Silk and the quality does not suffer in the slightest. The email client does what any email client should and sticks to it, checking and deleting emails. Though I will admit there is a lack of "select all emails" option, but this hardly matters to me. Being able to check my email is all I prefer. The calender (or day planner if you prefer) is simple and to the point, proving that not every feature has to come with forty or fifty functions.If you choose not to pay that extra 30.00 to remove special features, you are treated to a lockscreen with ads. I understand that should you pay to remove the ads, you are treated to a handful of features. But having ads on my kindle is nice, since it gives me access to new sales and I like to save money if I can help it.In the end, if you like stock android and long for it's customizability, then don't get an HDX. An HDX is for one group of people, fans of the amazon ecosystem, people who are aware of it not being similar to a stock android tablet and are fine with it. This tablet does well at what it was designed for, media consumption. Which honestly, is something that I prefer to be honest. I have a nexus 7 here and it didn't offer HALF of the functions that are found on an HDX. There is no having to pay over 20.00 to fix the problems present in stock android and thanks to mirror cast, you can use your HDX to stream movies to any mirror cast-enabled device. Over

Reviews.Title: Kindle
Reviews.Author: P.Badger
Reviews.Content: Well....my wife and I are Kindle fans.  This is fifth Kindle so we are sold on the performance.  The HDX is definitely fast than predecessor. I also like the addition of Bluetooth. Overall, just another great Kindle product.

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: Uwololli
Reviews.Content: I had the 2nd-gen fire and this is an amazing improvement in all regards.  Hardware, software, design, etc.  Must have and great alternative to other, more expensive, tablets.Note - leave the "special offers" on.  There are some pretty good ones and they only appear on the lock screen so not worth the $15 to remove.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: JERI COCAS
Reviews.Content: This is my second kindle with multiple generations between purchases. I wanted a reader that is backlit and light weight. Compared to my iPad, I enjoy my Kindle more for this reason alone. I ran rarely use my IPad anymore except when having a larger screen is required, with some internet searches or if I'm reading/using a receipt. I'm not a big app user so can't compare the two there.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY KINDLE!!
Reviews.Author: my2lilhogs
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle.  I bought this for myself to replace an original Kindle Fire.  There were some reviews that mention a blue "frame" around pages but I have never noticed anything like that.  I love being able to "fling" movies and the family really enjoys the x-ray feature.I use my Kindle for everything; address book, email, web, games, magazines, music, movies and most of all books.I really could not be happier.I bought the 7" because I like being able to fit it into my purse.  My daughter has the larger Kindle and that works for her but I love the convenience of the smaller one.I highly recommend this item to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds Apple at a more friendly price.
Reviews.Author: R. Laudig "Bobbimo"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have each had Fire HD 7 and 8.9 Tablets and been more than pleased with them. Prior to our purchasing them we each had a Nexus 7 which we liked, but sold them after purchasing our first Fire HD 7. The choice of this type of device is really a very personal one that is dependent upon what the device is purchased for. We are heavily invested in Amazon and, for us, the choice is a no-brainer. The quality and performance of the new HDX devices is equal to or better than any competition at this time. If you are looking for the top device for stunning multimedia entertainment, we believe the Fire HDX is unmatched. Much is made relative to the number of apps the Kindles have versus iPads and Google. We have found that for our use, Amazon is very adequate and, in addition, has some that are exclusive to Amazon. In the event one needs apps not found in the Amazon App Store, those apps can typically be side loaded in most cases. In addition Amazon has many more free or low cost books and apps then either of their main competitors. As a final important point, Amazon has unmatched customer support and service.

Reviews.Title: IF YOU'RE AVOIDING THIS PRODUCT READ THIS
Reviews.Author: Debra Goforth "debjg_tn"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product last week and my only complaint is its price dropped 30 dollars since then. I read the reviews and was curious about this "annoying blue border" that has caused so many negative reviews. But after receiving the Kindle HDX I forgot about it when I discovered the many new and fun features. Start up was so simple, and if this device was human I would marry it!!! So back to the blue border. I spent several days playing with it,and setting it up. Then I went back to the reviews. I finally saw this horrible distraction! A very light blue glow. From some of the reviews I expected a solid border. So on to testing how bad it was. I gave my daughter the device and asked her if she noticed anything strange about the screen. After she told me no. I pointed it out to her and she said she would not have noticed it if I hadn't pointed it out. I have AADHD and if it was really bad, I would have noticed it. I could almost believe that these comments were posted to reduce sales. Get a grip people. This is not a problem. The extra features far surpass this tiny problem. This device is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet for the money. LOVE.
Reviews.Author: Ashley Warcup
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer: this is the first tablet I have owned, so I can't offer much in the way of a comparison to, say, the iPad. However, I love this product and find that it suits all of my tablet needs.My kids both have the regular Kindle Fire Hd, and it's wonderful for them. But I recommend spending the extra $60 for the HDX.Pros:-Cost! I've never understood why people are willing to pay $500 for an iPad.-incredible resolution-accessibility to Amazon Prime features, like instant video, kindle ebooks, etc-wide selection of Android apps-I personally much prefer the Android operating system to the Apple iOS. Makes me miss my old Android phone.-lightening fast processorCons?-seems to take a long time to charge, and battery drains easily. Maybe this is all tablets. Not a big deal though if you charge overnight.-I find myself shopping on Amazon with reckless abandon. Well played, Amazon.Overall, excellent tablet for the money. Love it. I watch movies and tv shows on my kindle fire HDX more than on my tv these days. So easy. So clear.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic tablet with one HUGE limitation...
Reviews.Author: Eric K
Reviews.Content: I have wanted a small tablet for a long time to primarily use as a e-reader. My iPad feels too large and the 7" size of the Kindle and Nexus are much more like a paperback which is much easier to handle. I went with the Kindle primarily due to the holiday promotion where you could spread the payments out over several months with no interest. What a deal!It was so easy to set up and get new apps installed. Of course it was simple to get my Amazon content to it as well. The problem is that you are limited to Amazon for almost everything. No access to the Google Play store, which I knew before I bought the Kindle, but thought it would not be a big deal at all. Turns out I was wrong. There were several apps that were not available on the Amazon app store and that was ultimately the reason I ended up reluctantly returning it.Otherwise I was pleased with it. The interface was easy to use. The screen is gorgeous and anything I threw at it was fast due to the tremendous processor in the Kindle.I took the one star off due to the blocked access to Google Play but that is all. If that was removed, the Kindle would be hands down the best tablet on the market. As it is, it is the second best after the Nexus 7.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed
Reviews.Author: Dawn McDowell
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to get away from being tethered to my desktop computer and thought a tablet might help me with that. I first bought a Samsung Galaxy Tab 3, but after a couple weeks I just didn't feel I was getting much use out of it and returned it. I decided to try the Kindle because it was recommended at a few tech sites for people who are "already enmeshed in the Amazon ecosystem." Those people were right because I'm having a great time with this tablet. All my books are organized, when my music plays I get to see the lyrics (that feature alone makes this device a real winner), and the "send to Kindle" feature lets me move all sorts of documents, including recipes, from my computer to the Kindle with no frustration. Apps work great - Netflix, Feedly, TuneIn Radio, and Pocket! Pocket has totally changed my life, I'm not kidding.I don't know if the Kindle is working better for me because it's a good "beginner's" tablet or if it really is an "Amazon ecosystem" thing, but I'm having a great time with this. I've been able to switch all of my "media consumption" over to the tablet, and now I only need to sit down at the bigger computer to send e-mail, shop, and do other financial transactions (I feel better about the security set-up on the desktop, although apparently there are security apps such as Lookout available for tablets; I haven't made that leap yet). If you haven't had a tablet before, and especially if you're already an Amazon customer with a big library of music, books, etc., you will really enjoy using a Kindle tablet.

Reviews.Title: HDX 7" review
Reviews.Author: Ken Murphy
Reviews.Content: Well it is fast and it does have amazing graphics but here we go with the battery issues. I charged it to 100% and it is already about to die.......after only an hour.  And it is true that the power and volume buttons being on the back are an annoyance, especially when it's in it's case.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Kami
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire HDX. It's better than I thought it would be and my kids love it.... it's an awesome tablet...

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: Charlie Winick
Reviews.Content: SO GOOD I CAN'T EVEN EXPLAIN IT. Best present for christmas in a very long time for me at least.

Reviews.Title: Greatest thing I've bought in the past few years!!
Reviews.Author: Christopher Pili
Reviews.Content: For the price, very strong device.  No complaints what so ever. I would definitely recommend this device to a friend

Reviews.Title: I love this
Reviews.Author: Andi Jackson
Reviews.Content: It is easy to read books as well as internet searches. Love the recommendations and available apps. Good work Kindle.

Reviews.Title: best
Reviews.Author: Braelyn Keigley
Reviews.Content: Best thing ever I love it more than my iPod and iPad it is.so coolAnd has some cool apps just for.it, and I also like that u can drag ur finger across the keys to make typing easier and it has amazing picture so I recommend getting it 1. It's cheaper than an iPad 2. It's cooler and it really is like 30% lighter than the iPad air

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX vs iPad
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: We have both an iPad and Kindle Fire HDX. The battery on the Kindle lasts about 3 hours on a full charge while the IPad lasts all day. The Kindle does not continue to work on low battery even though it is plug in with the charger active. The app for "Words with Friends" keeps locking up or requires a second effort with each screen. Limited apps available compared to the iPad especially not offering College Hockey News (CHN not available on the Kindle even though it's a great app for college hockey buffs like me).Even though the Kindle Fire HDX is less expensive than the iPad sometimes you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Decent as a tablet
Reviews.Author: matt
Reviews.Content: I love the kindle, don't get me wrong, but if you want more than agreat reading experience, some casual web browsing, and few apps tochoose from, then a Kindle is not the way to go. The only reason Ithink this is because its more restricted than an iPad. I would love tobe able to do custom screen savers and not Amazon's adds. Also, you areonly able to use Kindle app store, which does not have even half theapps you can find on Google Play Store or Apple's app store. All inall, its a powerful tablet that is just very held back by Amazon'srestrictions. If they would give it more user customization access andthe full Android Google Play store,  it would be an amazing tablet andwould give all the competition a run for their money. Hopefully theconsumers voice is important and more feel the same way as I do.

Reviews.Title: I love it its great!!
Reviews.Author: Charles E. Roberts
Reviews.Content: Easy to operate. Fantastic HD. Very fast!! Is very reasonably priced. Travels great. So many apps to explore and movies to watch.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Martin
Reviews.Content: Amazing power, a little disappointed with the available apps but I think the vendor will catch up. For now I'm able to do the things I need to do. After getting my Kindle, I rarely have to use my laptop. I plan on sticking with it.

Reviews.Title: needed
Reviews.Author: Isabel laura Cuevas
Reviews.Content: Good but I can't customize it or get Adobe at all I really need that at times so please bring these options back on next update.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire evaluation
Reviews.Author: La Sierra Lanes
Reviews.Content: I do not care for this product.  It was a gift that I wish I had returned unopened.  SILK is to unlike any web browser that I have used on a computer.  Touch screen too difficult to use, should have come with a stylus as standard equipment.  Would not recommend this product to anyone that I think of as a friend.  Likely to cause the friend to wonder why I suddenly disliked them.

Reviews.Title: Good Looking But ........
Reviews.Author: F. Trinidad
Reviews.Content: Graphics is outstanding, well built, size and weight is just right. However there seems to be a bug  in its operating system. Immediately noticed while playing candy crash that game freezes, it just stopped. This happened with other apps too. I have to turn off the tablet to start again. Turning off the tablet means pressing the power button for 10-15 seconds. Did not bother for tech support, something is'nt right, this tablet is defective. Returned the tablet immediately. Amazon was  great in processing my return.

Reviews.Title: Problems with Kindle.
Reviews.Author: Darla Redmond
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle fire. And second time the Kindle has stopped working. After only a month of use, it no longer turns on. Since this is the second bad Kindle I no longer want to have a Kindle.

Reviews.Title: wifi
Reviews.Author: Jay Gilliss
Reviews.Content: My kindle fire HD is great when i can get it to connect to my wifi, my other kindles stay connected but the HD dosen't

Reviews.Title: Galaxy tab is way better
Reviews.Author: Sheldon C.
Reviews.Content: Yes, there's ample info out there about how kindle doesn't work with google play. Unfortunately for me, in my ignorance, I bought this as my first tablet. Shame on me. Even though the display, speed and instant support are laudable, I wish I'd bought the galaxy tab (which I ended up getting afterwards). It's much better in terms of apps and the display and speed are good enough for me. It can access all the amazon shopping and apps too (but not the limited amazon instant video like kindle can, but no big loss). Too bad the kindle doesn't reciprocate like most of rest of the anroid world. Untill it does, I wouldn't reccomend any kindle to anybody unless they only use amazon.

Reviews.Title: The Best Tablet.
Reviews.Author: Jill Payne
Reviews.Content: This is my second kindle. Hv paper white and now Hv Kindle hdx. I also own a very  over priced android tabket. The Kindle is the best tablet. Leaves the other over priced  tablet in the dust.  The.battery life is great. It's a very sweet tablet. I Hv the best 0f both worlds. A book read or and all the other perks that the Kindle has to offer.

Reviews.Title: how do i like it
Reviews.Author: paul voss
Reviews.Content: I  like it but have to get use to it and how to use it.  I am a slow learner

Reviews.Title: LOVE
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I hadn't read anything since high school. I bought the Kindle as a Christmas gift to myself and I love it. I've purchased several books and read many within a few weeks after buying it. It's basically a tablet when it comes to apps as well. Great product. I take it everywhere I go. very clear resolution. Never slows down.

Reviews.Title: Its Nice.  It does not replace a laptop.
Reviews.Author: Dia
Reviews.Content: I like to watch quilting youtube videos and they play beautifully.  I enjoy playing a couple of games on it.  It connects to WI FI ok wherever I go.  The youtube videos play nicely once I figured out how to enable the javascript.  Enjoy the games when I have to pass the time.  It is addictive.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fan
Reviews.Author: Twug "Poet"
Reviews.Content: My 1st Generation Kindle has served me well, but it was time for an upgrade.  This Fire?  It is a wonderful device.  I am not the most adept at technology, but I am learning as I go!  It would help to have a little starting knowledge, as it can be a bit overwhelming.  The display is crisp and beautiful.  It's slim and lightweight.  I was a little surprised that it didn't come with some sort of case, but that is not any reason to short this a star.  My 1st Generation's case will do for now.  I've only had it for a few days, but if my earlier Kindle's longevity is any indication as to how long these devices last, I look forward to at least five years of use or more.

Reviews.Title: love my HDX!
Reviews.Author: Happy Mama
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I am so glad I chose this one!  Small enough to fit in my purse and does everything I need it to.... very fast connection.  happy! happy! happy!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: David C Mohr
Reviews.Content: The quality of system response and video quality are exceptional.  You won't be disappointed at this price point.  Get Amazon Prime also.

Reviews.Title: Gift Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Clipityclop
Reviews.Content: Purchased two of the 7" kindles as presents for grand children. They are both very happy with them. I am glad I got them.

Reviews.Title: So far so good...
Reviews.Author: Ricky G
Reviews.Content: Nothing at this time...have not used it enough to give an honest opinion, but as of Xmas, it has been great

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase
Reviews.Author: greg
Reviews.Content: iPad user since launch day so the Kindle seemed to be a cheap replica.  I love this device.  It's easy to use and has a fantastic quality.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Sandra Blickhan
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire! It is the best gift hubby has ever gotten me! It's easy to use, nice and bright, just perfect. I can surf the Web or read a book. It's just great!

Reviews.Title: Worth every cent
Reviews.Author: Traci L
Reviews.Content: I purchased it for reading  mainly, then realized how fabulous it was to use the touch screen that reacts so fast and is so clear.  Know I hardly want to go and sit at my computer, I can do everything from anywhere in the house, except type a letter, and perhaps  you can do that to and I haven't even found out yet.  All the apps, it's incredible.

Reviews.Title: The BEST DAWN TABLET EVER FOR A COLLEGE STUDENT!!!!
Reviews.Author: Cecilia Milligan
Reviews.Content: I'm a USC, SC college student and also I'm hearing impaired student as well. Sometimes, I have the transcriber take notes for me in most of the classes and they'd send it to my email. This Kindle Fire HDX 7" have save my life and time to be able to read all my studying notes docs and receiving email are so usable. Also to mention e-textbook on here are way SOOOOO freaking superb!!!! If you're a college student, I'd def. recommend this coolest electronic device on the planet to anyone even its so light and easy to use than those other crazy heaviness 10" tablets.

Reviews.Title: Best thing other than a small computer!
Reviews.Author: Pam Becker Orren
Reviews.Content: I think the price is great for a solid tablet.  I find that I am surfing the web, listening to music, reading magazines, and books on it.  It exceeds my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Rebooting
Reviews.Author: W Montgomery "Bill M."
Reviews.Content: I am a tech person and avid reader. I only use my Kindle for reading books. This I my 4th Kindle.  I have never had issues in the past. However, the freezing and rebooting is a problem.  I used Mayday feature and appreciated the response speed and the fact that English was their fist language, but was not told that a hard reset would remove all my books.  It also did not solve the problem which I notice has been on the discussion boards since day 1.I may have to go back to my Kindle Fire and wait on the HDX to get fixed.

Reviews.Title: What a great product
Reviews.Author: D. Lemieux
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle and they just keep getting better and better.The screen and resolution is so vivid and has a very fast processor, but I still wish they would make one that you could plug in either an SD or Mini SD flash card in it. But I give this Kindle a BIG 5 star. I also love doing business with Amazon, they are the best on-line company to do business with. Keep up the GREAT work AMAZON!

Reviews.Title: Smart buy
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: Great device, simple to use. I love using it and so does my kid. I would give it 5 stars but the camera location is inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: awesome....
Reviews.Author: Kerry
Reviews.Content: ... and easy to use. Love searching the web and downloading lots of games, apps, magazines, and books. Best Christmas present!

Reviews.Title: Lovin' it
Reviews.Author: Tim Girard
Reviews.Content: I am a PC guy. That being said it took me a little while to get used to my Kindle. But I am glad I took the time! This little guy is nifty and nifty again! I love this thing. I am not into the big fancy stuff. A little multimedia and the opportunity to work on my writing thank you and we'll all get along just fine. The Kindle Fire offers that and then some. I dig mine, dig it a lot actually. And I would recommend it to others not only for the easy interface but also for the price and durability. A cool device!

Reviews.Title: ipad replacement
Reviews.Author: vdubbgirl
Reviews.Content: this is the first tablet that i've compared to my iPad mini with retina that came as close enough to not justify all the money apple charges for it iPad.  And the price makes it the iPad killer for me.  Thanks Amazon and Kindle!  love it

Reviews.Title: Blue/Purple Haze- Very disappointing
Reviews.Author: Traditionalist
Reviews.Content: Amazon has disclosed the fact that the blue LED attribute of the HDX 7" creates a blue/purple haze around the edges of white reading pages and white web pages. While this blue LED attribute may provide true colors for movies, games, photos, etc., it is most distracting and disturbing to readers. I have an older 32GB Fire HD, and the reading light has none of this blue/purple tinge. Before ordering this unit, I contacted customer service and was told that the problem existed only on a small number of units, and that I could replace the unit if the problem occurred. When I received the unit, the problem was very apparent, and I have decided to simply return the unit and order the newer Kindle Fire HD 7", which uses white light LED. I would have preferred to replace it with my older generation Kindle Fire HD 7", a more enhanced unit, but Amazon no longer sells that model. Since first writing this review I have received the newer Kindle Fire HD 16gb, and there is no blue haze on the unit. I do not miss the camera, microphone, and auto adjust brightness features. So, for $184 for the HD vs. $254 (with $30 deal)on the HDX, I believe I have come out ahead and ultimately purchased the model that is right for me.

Reviews.Title: ... ***  So Much More than just an eBook reader....***
Reviews.Author: Wildman Keith
Reviews.Content: __  Just in case you might not know it, you can download a kindle app for your PC.  I only mention this because a lot of people don't know they can read Kindle books on their laptop or desktop computer or Android or other devices. ___My favorite feature of the Kindle is the ability to get online and check on stuff such as email, facebook, Google+, various websites and even read USA Today if you want to check on the leading stories.Its size and portability give it an edge over a laptop.  So much easier and handier to carry.Its screen size give it an edge over a smart phone.  Everything is easier to see plus you can enlarge the view by dragging diagonally outwards on the screen.The reason I got the 4G LTE version is that I spend a lot of time where Wi Fi isn't available.  You need the ability to get online when you are out in the field and not at a wi-fi hotspot.-- My personal recommendation is to go with Verizon.  When it comes to 4G  I have found ATT just doesn't cut it in a lot of places. I found this out years ago when I made the mistake of getting a laptop modem that plugged into the USB outlet on the side of my computer.  I had been very happy with a Verizon 3G but thought I would upgrade to an ATT 4G.The ATT laptop modem was very slow...  almost as slow as dial up when it was out in rural areas.  It did OK hooked up to a Wi-Fi hotspot but wasn't worth much when it came to using the ATT wireless network.  Checking reviews after I bought the modem showed others had the same problem.I hope this review might help you if you have been thinking about upgrading your Kindle or getting your first one.  Good luck and enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Gloria G. Goodman
Reviews.Content: I really like this kindle. The only thing I am not happy with is the fact that it only has a front camera.

Reviews.Title: Love the kindle
Reviews.Author: Freda Lucas "theatre buff"
Reviews.Content: Love my kindle fire so much easier than carrying around my bulky laptop and downloads so much faster and so easy

Reviews.Title: great gift
Reviews.Author: Ariel Acevedo
Reviews.Content: its pretty awesome. i use it for school, and for watching movies. best gift my dad has gotten me from christmas.

Reviews.Title: Good Product!
Reviews.Author: Glenn Knight
Reviews.Content: Got this for my wife for Christmas and she loves it.  Has read multiple books on it and enjoys being able to carry it.  Good size over a full on tablet.

Reviews.Title: fast shipping
Reviews.Author: Ernest Stille
Reviews.Content: awesome product, easy and friendly  tech support i would consider purchasing another one from amazon if they were giving the deals they were before christmas.

Reviews.Title: I love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Dawn Wright
Reviews.Content: In reading the reviews I was a bit worried about the blue light around the outside of the screen but I haven't noticed it and have to consciously look for it.  I did get a screen cover and a stylus as things can get pretty small and a stylus works much better than your finger to tap the correct thing.  I am very happy with the resolution and the sound.  My only wish is that I would have liked an instruction booklet as this is my first kindle as well as my first tablet.  I keep finding things that  I didn't know were there.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little tablet.
Reviews.Author: SheilaW
Reviews.Content: Very functional for the cost & for beginners. Sharp images, ease of use and light. It also has a great functional cover. Very satisfied with this product.

Reviews.Title: 3rd Kindle
Reviews.Author: Daniel Harmount
Reviews.Content: Had issues with the first Kindle Fire HDX 7" with the system shuting down every time I tried to connect to wifi.  Second Kindle did the same thing but also froze alot when ever I was using the wifi...I hope the third is ok.Customer service has been great and trying to fiqure out what is wrong.I believe maybe it is just my luck because I had the old kindle and loved it.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Best Gift this year!!!
Reviews.Author: Nancy Livrieri
Reviews.Content: Got the 3 guys in my house the best unexpected Christmas present with this item!!!! They absolutely love them! The best part for me is I got them at a fantastic price on Cyber-Monday!!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Don L.
Reviews.Content: So fast and easy to use.I bought the Kindle to use when traveling to get e-mails.The display is crystal clear.This is my first tablet and I am very happy with it.Don

Reviews.Title: Totally Addicted
Reviews.Author: Steve S.
Reviews.Content: The measure of how awesome the Kindle is is I don't use my cell phone for any apps or games anymore. The cell's just for calls and texts. The display quality is truly awesome, the screen size is perfect for games and reading.  Truly, I don't know how I lived without this Kindle. A wonderful gift, too.

Reviews.Title: i love it!
Reviews.Author: Loren A Stevens
Reviews.Content: I take it everywhere and use it all the time for work and play. It is perfect for my needs.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!!!
Reviews.Author: Theresa M. Studer "Terra57"
Reviews.Content: I should no better than to question myself when looking for something major as I went and bought a name brand tablet before buying the Kindle Fire HDX and the said name brand tablet turned out to be a piece of garbarge.  Amazon has done an outstanding job with the Kindle Fire and I for one will never buy anything other than this in the future.  It works just that well.  I'm so happy now with my Kindle and it does everything all the other tablets do for a fraction of the cost.  You won't be sorry that's for sure so make sure and give this a try.  You will be very happy you did.

Reviews.Title: HAPPY, HAPPY, HAPPY
Reviews.Author: OSCAR SOLANO
Reviews.Content: I'm too lazy to ever write reviews, but I just had to get a quick word out about how much I love my Kindle. I've owned every iPad and iPad mini there is, so I wasn't expecting to love the Kindle this much, or the closed Amazon Android shop.  But, in all fairness, the services and features that Amazon has implemented into their device make it a great reader and video device, I love being able to download free prime movies on the go and having my books with me. After being so long on the fence and Amazon making it harder to resist, I finally jumped. Now I can't wait to see what else Amazon has in store for us.

Reviews.Title: Works perfect, the kids love them!
Reviews.Author: Jeremy May "Jeremy May"
Reviews.Content: I chose 5 stars because this little Kindle is awesome.  When we first received the kindle before Christmas, we wanted to load apps and books on them for the kids.  Thanks to the one push "help" button we were instantly connected to a live person that helped us obtain a critical update that was needed in order to download the apps and books.  The price of these tablets are much less than other brands and the free app selection is just as good through amazon as google play.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I first had a Kindle Touch, then got a Kindle Fire, then I upgraded to the HDX. I love it so much because I have all my books with me at all times and it is easy to carry around.

Reviews.Title: Uses Android Apps, but no access to Google Play Store
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: With an Android device, you can access the Amazon Android store, but with a Kindle Fire, you cannot access the Google Play store. It's frustrating, but nothing to keep you from buying this Kindle. I bought two - one for each daughter - and they love them. Whether they are reading, playing games, on Twitter, Facebook, etc., it's smooth, light, and the picture is crystal clear.One other thing - there is no back side camera. The only camera is on the front side (screen side), so taking video or a picture with it is difficult because you can't see the screen. Why no back camera?A back camera and access to the Google Play Store would have been enough for five stars. Without, however, four stars.Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: JPMass
Reviews.Content: I've had the HDX for a little over a month now and I love the device. I've been an iPad user for a few years and just wanted to try something different. Since I've bought the HDX I've barely touched my iPad. I've always used tablets for more of an entertainment purpose and I feel that the HDX does that even better than the iPad. The screen on the HDX is amazing. Reading books and watching movies looks fantastic. The OS moves along with speed and I never notice a stutter. Even browsing with the HDX feels great. You can tell the Silk browser has come a long way. My only regret so far has been not getting the 8.9 inch instead of the 7 inch. Although, I may pick up the 8.9 soon anyway.If I had to knock one thing it would be what everyone else says, the limited app store. Coming from an iPad you'll definitely notice a much more limited selection BUT, it's actually not too bad. There are more apps being added constantly and so far I've found everything I've needed in the app store.

Reviews.Title: Not as glamorous as it was made it out to be - Several "Features" make it less valuable.
Reviews.Author: K. Scanlon
Reviews.Content: The Good:It’s an awesome Kindle.  Books are easy to read, Screen clarity is great, Movies play back beautiful (if you can get them downloaded), Mayday customer support is great and worked well when I used it.  Battery life is pretty good. Thin and user friendly.The Bad:The apps that they do allow you download are not like the Android ones I am used to.  Do not expect a ton of Android type apps.  You have little or no control over the information they can access on your kindle or amazon.  It seems to me that Amazon does not value the privacy of our personal information. Some Apps even make you agree to allow them to share PERSONAL INFORMATION with other advertisers and "partners" before allowing you to install.  If you don’t agree, you cannot install.  The Facebook Application terms that are levied by amazon/Facebook are egregious, so I won’t install that app.The Special offers are not so special...Basically they hold your screen saver hostage with advertisements and movie promos.  If you want to remove them, it will cost you a fee.  (I think $15) Therefore, ads come with the Kindle.Bottom Line:  They have a great product here and they know it, I would have rated it a 5 Star if not for the BS.  It’s not like it used to be, buy our product and use it as you wish.  You must use it the way they want you to and accept their terms or don’t use it.  Imagine buying a TV and not being able to watch certain channels, having automatic ads or commercials come on when you turn the TV on and finally, in order to use the TV you have to accept the fact that they will share the information you watch with certain advertisers.  This HDX could have been a very special product, it stands on its merits and abilities, but Amazon wants to tell you how you can use it.

Reviews.Title: Okay.
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: It is okay, not as good as hyped.Pros:ResponsiveGreat pictureCons:FreezesCan't completely close applicationsSpeakers point backwards which is annoying since they are great, but you can't hear them and watch something at the same time.Overall:I am sending it back and getting a Windows Surface since there is more you can do with it.  I am worried that this one will freeze again, leaving me signed into all my applications so if I send it back the service tech will be able to get into my info...not really happy about this purchase.

Reviews.Title: aweful battery life
Reviews.Author: Hernan H Quintanar
Reviews.Content: upgraded from my kindle 6 e ink display…. HDX 7" battery sucks.  charged both of them at the same time, unplug them at the same time, didn't used them for 3 days, picked up the HDX 7" to read, and find out that I need to charge it again, my kindle 6 e ink not even 1/4 waisted.  Bad performance for Kindle Fire HDX7"

Reviews.Title: wi-fi drops constantly
Reviews.Author: peter maus
Reviews.Content: The wi-fi connection drops constantly for no apparent reason. Some days it works fine but once it starts acting up, it will continuously drop connection every 2 - 10 seconds.  My other devices have never had an issue.  If the connection issues were resolved, I would give this 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet and e-reader
Reviews.Author: SDBolts619
Reviews.Content: I received the 16gb version with special offers for Christmas and am just now sending it back in so I can upgrade to the 64gb version.  I love the tablet - great performance, perfect size - it even fits in my pocket when I'm wearing slacks.  I love it as an e-reader and it works great with Chromecast enabled apps to send streaming content to my TV.  The only drawbacks are that certain apps aren't available yet in the Amazon app store, but there are ways around this for many of them - search for 'sideload apps' for the Fire HDX to research how.  Other than that, I like having my own lock screen and such, so my upgraded version will be without the Special Offers.  I haven't found those too annoying - I just swipe past them, but still it's worth it to me to not deal with them.  I'd say this is a must if you're a Prime member as well.  The loaner books, streaming content and such available as a Prime member makes this far and away the tablet of choice even if you discount the fact that the hardware is second to none in the market currently.

Reviews.Title: good job
Reviews.Author: eric ramirez
Reviews.Content: great product, great picture and battery life! sleek and light weight. speakers sound good for the size of the object

Reviews.Title: New Toy
Reviews.Author: allegra
Reviews.Content: This is my second Fire..The picture quality is great..The battery only lasts a day..The HD lasted longer.It is glitch on keeping a Wi-Fi connection.Doesn't load the new mail very fast..Wish you could make photo albums..Do love the book collections.

Reviews.Title: It is the best device I have
Reviews.Author: bajaguy
Reviews.Content: I got a great price on Cyber Monday...it does everything I need to do...email, movies, news live, video download to cloud...I haven't used my desktop computer for weeks, this device and the 7" screen is just right.

Reviews.Title: This Apple IPad owner is a Kindle Fire believer!
Reviews.Author: K.V.C.L. "K.V.C.L."
Reviews.Content: ***UPDATE***I have now owned my kindle for about 3 months and I've read more books in that time than I had in the past YEAR. The Kindle is an INCREDIBLE tool for readers - and for those who may be averse to picking up a paperback. I honestly never thought of myself as an avid novel reader, but this gadget has totally changed that and I look forward to the breaks where I get to read. My only problem now is finding more great books to read! (For the record I have read, and thoroughly enjoyed these books on my kindle: Night Film (Marisha Pessl), World War Z (Max Brooks), Zone One (Colson Whitehead). I also read an advance copy of my sister's book, which I had read before but enjoyed even more on second reading on the kindle (another excellent tool -- your kindle can convert a PDF into a Kindle doc! So Cool! All you need to do is email the PDF to your kindle email with the word "CONVERT" in the subject, and voila! It shows up in your "Docs" as a Kindle-version of the PDF which is much easier read and navigated than a PDF). So, in short WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR? BUY THIS THING NOW!***I was a little hesitant buying this having been a tried and true Apple fan. First though, I should explain that you REALLY want to buy this without the special offers. It's a little more money, but if you DON'T pay the extra, you see ads on the home screen every time you open up the device. So yeah, pay the extra to get rid of thes ads.As for the device itself, it is FAST. Like, the fastest operating system of anything in our house including my MacBook Pro, iPad or any of our iPhones. I LOVE reading on it too. The screen doesn't make your eyes ache like the iPad, and the text is really easy and clear to read. It is also super duper light weight.The only downside I've seen so far is there is no integration with Chromecast, which would be awesome.Overall though, really impressed with this little device, and would highly recommend it to anyone considering buying it. Do it. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Man Toy!
Reviews.Author: Beverly Asher
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this to all ages, all genders.  What fun!  Love having Prime to get apps, books, movies, tv shows, you name it, if it is digital its on the Kindle.  Lots of fun for down time at work - am over 65 and a school bus driver.  Great gift, good times!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Kennith Hill
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my 9 year-old son.  He has shared our iPads for a couple of years, but had enough android experience, through smart phones, that the transition was seamless.  This little tablet works perfectly.  It took only minutes to set it up and have it running.  Unlike the apples, there is no need to connect to a PC; just set up the wi-fi connection, and the rest is very simple.  The display is exceptionally crisp, with vibrant colors, making it a perfect companion for Amazon's Prime Video.  For games, apps, and video it is perfect.  I wouldn't mind having one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Best value compared to other tablets, including iPad
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Gift for 8 year old. Wanted an iPad all year long until he saw that commercial comparing Kindle to IPad. This changed His mind and even prompted him to write a new letter (change order) to Santa. Which worked out well for him because Santa did not have an iPad in his budget. My son loves the kindle. My one complaint is the parental controls. I do not think that they are as functional for us as we were led to believe. Even the netflix app doesn't have a kids only section like on the tv and on the iPad. Not a deal breaker but we do need to closely monitor what he is watching. Other than that the kindle more than serves our purpose. My son loves it (when he can pry it out of the hands of his mother and father)... ;)

Reviews.Title: Best kindle available
Reviews.Author: Nancy G.
Reviews.Content: Love,love it!  Fast and efficient a pleasure to download apps.  The screen is spectacular which makes watching movies and playing games so much more enjoyable. It is my go-to tablet.

Reviews.Title: Super Buy, Great color display.
Reviews.Author: Baffuor1
Reviews.Content: Awesome product, beautiful, sharp color display, and fast wifi internet access too. Already used the mayday feature, and it was awesome. Ready access to live help.

Reviews.Title: awesome!
Reviews.Author: Megan
Reviews.Content: Just got this product yesterday and love it so far! Had a small issue getting my books to load but used the pushbutton and got help quickly and problem resolved. This is very easy to use and figure out. I didn't even realize how much my toddler would be able to do but kindle free time might be the coolest thing ever. Now I can let him use my kindle and not worry about him getting into anything that he shouldn't be in because once in free time you need a password to exit!  Apple can't even compete with that!  What a great product. Worth every penny and cheaper than an Apple product and still has same apps. Great job Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Have 2 and we love them
Reviews.Author: Johnny "JG."
Reviews.Content: I got 2 of these, one for me and one for my wife. We both enjoy them. We got the ones that have the ads on the home screen and I don't see how this could possibly bother others, once your off that page, like in 1 second, you don't see them anymore. Flash would be nice to have and I understand there are ways to install it with a new browser but I've only found one site I would have needed it on anyway. Your not going to get flash with an iPad either.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: five times the cat
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle.I have owned the original Kindle fire,the 2012 Kindle fire HD and now the HDXHere is what I love about it:* Its super light weight.It feels much lighter than the previous versions of the Kindle fire.* The screen is super bright.Yes,my screen has the slight purplish edge.Yes,its noticeable...But I was able to get used to it. Admittedly I was initially disappointed with the purplish edge.My advice if your HDX has that issue is to use your HDX for a few days.I now only notice it if i'm looking for it.* Everything is faster on the HDX.The internet is blazing fast on the HDX.Mine holds the connection well at home and at free wifi locations.* Navigation is much improved.On previous models you sometimes had to tap multiple times to get the screen to respond. Also typing was wonky.Most of the navigation worries seem to be a thing of the past.* It's nice and loud.Here is what bothers me a little :* Charging port is horrible. It goes in on an upward angle. Does not feel or look stable.Makes me wonder WHY is it designed like that.* Battery life is less than the previous model(2012 Kindle fire HD) Does not last long on standby.* I wish the power button and the volume were NOT located on the back of the HDX. I prefered the previous button locations.* I used the Mayday button to ask a question about printing from my HDX.Specifically I wanted to know where on the HDX could I  access the print screen amazon shows a shot of in the product tour video. Well my advisor answered fast but when I asked my question she kind of rolled her eyes and made an exasperated sigh. She then said hold on.Her screen went from a live shot of her to a graphic of a pair of headphones.Then another voice started talking to me. It turns out the Mayday advisor transferred me to a amazon phone support rep.I had to repeat my question and she then said she would email some info about how to print from a Kindle.Overall, I think its a great tablet.If you're thinking of  upgrading your 2012 Kindle fire HD.I say go for It. There are plenty of improvements to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire HDX 7"
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I love it!I purchased it the end of Oct 2013, still having fun easy learning even for a beginner. Have used the "0n line helpline. Great experience. Yes will still have some kinks to work out but due to me more in comprehending new technologies.I am 71 years old so first time with the tablet.I have cataracts that are not ripe yet so love the fact that I can brighten the lighting and fonts.

Reviews.Title: A second look at the Kindle HDX 7", 32 GB
Reviews.Author: Tiggy Moore
Reviews.Content: This is actually the second Kindle HDX 7" that I have had. The first, which I ordered before Christmas 2013 (a 16 GB machine, wi-fi only), had to be returned because of the blue halo-ing screen issue. Although I liked it, I already knew that if I tried the Kindle again, it would also have to have a larger storage capacity. So when Radio Shack had Kindles marked down for New Year's, I bit the bullet and grabbed a 32 gig. I am happy to report that the new machine does not have the screen issue and seems to work fine.My impressions of this tablet are that it is the perfect companion to tote around in lieu of its larger far removed cousin, the iPad. (True, the iPad Mini is just as good for a 7" tablet.) Although one is a modified version of Android, and the other is iOS, they pretty much do the same thing, which is give the user the ability to consume media, albeit on different levels. It is true that Apple does have a larger app selection, and that some Google apps are totally shut out of the Amazon ecosystem--but I haven't found that to be a problem because the basic apps I want to access: News, Netflix, internet and a few others are available on both platforms. I also have no problem issue with the fact that the device only has a front facing camera. I don't Skype or use a tablet camera anyway, so it's a moot point. Both my phone and iPod 5th gen have cameras that work just fine when I want to snap a pix. People who complain about the lack really should research before they purchase an item. There are multiple review platforms on YouTube that show the actual device in real-world situations. Lack of knowledge is not an excuse when you have access to the internet.As for how the Kindle HDX functions, I will give it a thumbs up. The display is crystal clear, the sound is decent and the ability to access the content I want works just fine. It is true the tablet is linked directly to Amazon, but this isn't a problem. I am not a Prime member, but may go ahead and join later on. I also don't mind the screen saver-come-advertising, which often offers great deals in books I am interested in. It's not as annoying as I thought it would be, and I can always pay the 20 dollars later on if I decide I want ads removed.Overall, this is a nice little tablet to tote around, and covers everything you want at hand if you're confined to a situation where you want the basics without carrying around a laptop or larger iPad. Put on a nice case, throw it in a bag and go. You've got books, movies, email and internet on hand. Perfect in every way.One more thing I might mention. Yes, it is compatible with iTunes without having to purchase conversion software, and you can transfer your entire library to the Kindle with a few clicks. Sure, it takes a simple workaround, but the music transfers fine, even if you've purchased most your music through Apple, as I have.A+ to Amazon for creating an affordable, fun little tablet. And solid 10 to customer service, which is always a pleasure to deal with.

Reviews.Title: awsome
Reviews.Author: jimstur
Reviews.Content: I bought this Kindle for my son and I couldn't be more pleased. Very fast and functional. My son is a very recriminating technology user and for him to give it the thumbs up means everything.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 7", HDX Display, Wi-Fi, 16 GB - Includes Special Offers
Reviews.Author: Deb in Spokane
Reviews.Content: I'm absolutely surprised and delighted with this purchase. This is my first electronics update since a laptop in 2007...I've missed a lot but this Kindle made it incredibly easy to catch up. Even my 80-year-old Dad who refused to look at a computer is using this! The Special Offers are not intrusive. Start up is a snap. I bought a keyboard case but this is absolutely unnecessary as the tablet keyboard is extremely easy to use. I love the small size for ease of transport. I compared it to an 8" iPad 3 and size and content of the iPad 3 is not worth the additional hundreds of dollars. Thrilled with this update of my electronic life and am looking forward to maintaining my Amazon Prime membership. So far, this has been an exceptional purchase!

Reviews.Title: Come on in, the water's fine.
Reviews.Author: J. Harbour
Reviews.Content: About fifteen years ago I had a Dell Inspiron that caught on fire and melted. Yes, I was one of those with the bad battery. I received such poor customer service that I went out and replaced the Dell with the Apple PowerBook, their main competitor at the time. And, I never looked back. I have been a part of the Apple ecosystem for more than a decade now, and couldn’t be happier. The design, the experience, the quality. Yes, I know, I’m trapped in their rigid world and the man is holding me down.When they came out with the iPad the public said, huh? We don’t need this, and then gobbled them up by the millions, because Apple had figured out what we were about to. People don’t like to relax with laptops. Open that thing up and you feel the need to do something. It’s because of the keyboard. It’s an input device that is waiting, begging, for your attention. But a tablet is pure consumption. No work required. Just sit back, read a book, play a game, watch a movie. They adopted the Gillette model of business: They didn’t sell the razor handles to make money, they sold the razor handles to sell you blades. The blades here are the apps. And Apple made millions off of the apps. Then came the followers with cheap, poorly made tablets to try and compete and each got smacked down in the process.So here I am with a first generation iPad, yes you read that right — first gen, and I’m looking to upgrade. I’m thinking the new iPad mini because I want a smaller form factor for flights. It’s before Christmas and I’m in BJ’s. The Christmas lights are blinking and everything is warm and bright. I spy an Amazon Kindle Fire on sale for $99. That’s interesting I think and I move along with the tasks at hand. The thought sticks in my mind and I start investigating the Kindle line. I’m already in deep into the Amazon system; Being a writer my wares are mostly sold there, I need to follow Goodreads daily, and for movies I’m already a Prime member. I take a hard look at how I use the iPad. Email, check. Browse the web, check. Watch some movies, check. But mostly I use it to read books and magazines through the Kindle app. I abandoned  iBooks  years ago. I should support my biggest professional partner, I think, and then start really looking at the Kindle line. Amazon, too, follows the Gillette model. They are selling the HDX almost at cost so that it is easier to buy books, apps, and anything else that Amazon sells.So I dig. I read. I go to Best Buy to showroom the models. And I’m surprised. They’re good. They’re damn good. And they are half the price of the iPad with the same specs (64GB). I make a decision I didn’t think I would two years ago when the first one came out…I placed my order with Santa for a Kindle Fire HDX and waited for Christmas.Fast forward to now. Of course I got the Kindle as Santa is a close friend of mine and I have been giving it a stress test probably only seen in the Amazon Lab. Along with the Nexus 7 (Not Microsoft. Microsoft still doesn’t get it, they want to make you work on the damn things.) there is a serious threat to Apple’s market share. It is a beautiful piece of kit. Sleek and light with a rubberized back that makes it easy to hold while reading. The Kindle Fire is my new best friend. It took me a day or two to get used to where the buttons were but now I can’t imagine them in a different place. The performance is amazing. HD games feel like they are on a console and reading on it is a joy. I know there are some complaints about the blue hue around the edges of the screen. It’s there, but I’m okay with it. Those that keep returning theirs because of the hue are, in my opinion, a bit of the Princess and the Pea. Myself, I’m impressed and ecstatic about the device, and can’t say enough about it. If I find something, I’ll post it here but don’t hold your breath.Will I give up my MacBook Air? Not a chance in hell. iPhone? Possibly. iPad? Yes. Kindle Fire HDX? You make the call.

Reviews.Title: Great reading tool and tablet
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey W. Armstrong "Jeff Armstrong"
Reviews.Content: Great for everything I need and my only complaint is I have a hard time pulling away from it...  Also it's much too easy now to order more stuff from Amazon.  Believe this is a plot by Amazon.  You guys are brilliant. Great tablet.

Reviews.Title: Kindle HDX 7" 16 GB
Reviews.Author: MIKE G.
Reviews.Content: I have had three kindles and I enjoy each and every one of them! The HDX is by far the sharpest and simplest to use to date. I am in my mid fifties and some times fumble on electric gadgets and getting frustrated at working with things that others seem to have no problems with. I find the Kindles to be very user friendly and I have yet to use the help feature to navigate or search for secrets that I think some designers fit in just to aggravate some of us?...Kidding! I have had no real difficult times down loading or up loading video or books, music and what not. I realy like using this as I find myself late for appointments because I get lost in just playing.Buy it play with it and you too can miss appointments  and lose track of time.

Reviews.Title: One of the best Android tablets I have used for the price value
Reviews.Author: KevinW42
Reviews.Content: It was either between the Fire HDX 7 and a Google Nexus 7. My choice came when I saw benchmarks that showed the Fire HDX 7 with Qualcomm Snapdragon 800 processor 2.2ghz and Adreno 320 GPU outshined the Nexus 7 tablet. It plays movies very nicely especially those which were filmed in high defintion like Jet Li's new title The Sorceror and the Witch. Colors were gorgeous watching that movie and outshined most other titles I have played on the tablet. By far for the money this beats any unknown model you might find elsewhere. Unlike most budget tablets this one has an Update Feature so you can upgrade to the latest Android versions without having to Root and take the chance of bricking your tablet. I hope Amazon will improve on there Sense Interface screen, I would like to be able to see what apps are running in the background. Right now you have to go to the Settings and Application Control screen and it will let you Force Stop apps that are running in the background. Most Apps let you use the Left Back Arrow to EXIT an Application, however some apps do not have this feature and they continue to run in the background until you go to Settings/Application Control and pick Force Stop for any games you exit that still run in the background.

Reviews.Title: My views on the Kindle 7 HDX.
Reviews.Author: Jim Kuhn
Reviews.Content: I own other tablets, but find my Kindle quickly becoming my go-to choice. With its ability to cover multiple email providers it makes itself the practical choice when you can only choose one tablet to carry. The visual clarity of its screen is unsurpassed. Its sound is robust and clear. The Kindle's physical dimensions are outstanding. It is remarkably thin and light. I can hold it for long periods of time in complete comfort. The Kindle has become the tablet I give as a gift. I give the Kindle my unreserved endorsement.

Reviews.Title: Review of the kindle fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Douglas E. Swagger
Reviews.Content: The kindle HDX is a great tablet the color is outstanding an the game controls are too. The two things that I do not like about it is that you have to get a miracast (PTV 3000) that are about $58.00 to makes it wireless to play moves an other thing on your tv. That is nice but it would be nice if could use a cable like on the kindle HD you can get for about $2.00 to$5.00 to do the same thing. The other thing is I wish it had  the charge light on it like the kindle fire dose. Other then that I still give it five stars it's a great tablet.

Reviews.Title: Lived up to all my expectations
Reviews.Author: John I. Cody
Reviews.Content: I am new to the tablet arena so I really don't have experience with other tablet type devices to compare with, however I have had the Kindle HDX for a month now and so far it has lived up to all my expectations.I've been able to surf the Internet with no problems, I have watched TV programs and movies with no problems my e-mail program works just fine.I'm still working on finding the apps that work best for me but I've been told that that's kind of a trial and error process.The display is crisp and the sound is of high quality. The device itself is sturdy, and I have been told by a friend of mine who has a Kindle HD that the HDX is much faster.The only negative that I have found is the camera. The picture quality is good however with only the front facing camera it makes taking pictures somewhere awkward. This is not a deal breaker for me but it may be for others.

Reviews.Title: An entertainment device
Reviews.Author: Matthew H.
Reviews.Content: I have been using this device for about 2 weeks now. Firstly I will address the many issues people tend to have with this device and comment on my personal situation.Wifi - Setting up Wifi at first was a little shotty as my router had to be reset a couple of times to allow it to access the kindle. At random times it seems like it drops wifi but this happens infrequently and isnt all that annoying unless it is during a video.Blue Tint - This is noticeable on my device on white screens but perhaps I wouldnt have even seen it hadnt I read so many reviews on it. It really doesnt bother me all that much and I turn the kindle to dark view when reading anyways. Unless yours is really bad I think this is just people nitpicking.Battery - So far it has been pretty strong. I watched a lot of media on this device and I have seen it last anywhere from 7-12 hours. I have noticed it depends on strength of wifi and screen brightness mostly. I watched 4 episodes of Justified last night and it only dropped about 25-30%.App Store - This is one of those things that people can research pretty indepthly before purchasing the device, so why people complain about it is beyond me. They are missing some key apps outside of google play store but many of them can be sideloaded using 1mobilemarket or an equivalent. I have noticed the apps through amazon are generally a version or two behind but its not a deal breaker.I understand you cant do this on an ipad either, but I wish you could rename apps. I hate when I download an app from Amazon and it has a weird name and throws it off alphabetically when I am looking for it.Now for the positives:Screen - The picture on this device is immaculate. Watching media is very crisp and enjoyable even on the 7" device. The colors are accruate.Speakers - The speakers are very good on this device, much better than expected. It is perfect for watching on your lap, table or bed. They dont get too loud but I have never, as of yet, needed to watch something with them a full capactiy.Media - One of the key selling points is the ability to download videos to the device for offline viewing. I have noticed that the xfinity app allows you to do the same thing that Amazon has promised w this device. There are not many great movies to download and people are upset w this through Amazon Prime Video, however the list of tv shows is exceptional. They have a lot where you can either view/download the videos to the device. Amazon prime is strongly suggested if you were to purchase this device.Reading - Reading is a delight on this device. Very crisp and sharp and I love that you can download overdrive and rent books via your library. The Amazon Kindle Lending library is very weak and if you are considering this as a reason to buy then forget it all together.Overall I am very impressed with this device and at $229 ($179 on cyber monday) it is definitley worth a buy. It is more of a media consumption device then a tablet so to speak. I notice that when I am using it I seem to run out of things to do on it, unlike an iphone/ipad but still I think it is a great device for the budget conscious buyer.

Reviews.Title: Bought as a gift for my wife - she won't put it down
Reviews.Author: J. Scholz
Reviews.Content: My wife is not a technical person. She wants things that "just work" so after debating between a Nexus 7 versus this, I ended up going with the Kindle.The special offers are unobtrusive and easily ignored. The screen is amazing - better than the iPad by far and pretty comparable to the Nexus 7 I use. She uses it for reading, Facebook, Pinterest, and a few other apps. Though I would prefer that Amazon just use the Google Play store she gets along well enough with Amazon's app store, despite the fact that common apps such as Google Chrome are missing.The Kindle also has some annoying limitations on customization. My wife wanted to change the background to a picture but apparently that feature is not implemented for some odd reason. She also wanted to rename it from Kindle #2 but apparently that is not allowed either. I think the tradeoff in being easy to use might have overstepped a bit here, as asking to put your own pictures on as a background shouldn't really be an issue, nor should renaming it to be more personally named be such an issue either. Perhaps a future upgrade will address these easy-to-fix usability issues.As to whether or not I would get her this again I would go with "definitely". Despite the missing features and apps this is a solid tablet that I feel will stand up to her use for many years.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Love
Reviews.Author: David & Tia Fennick
Reviews.Content: Extremely impressed with this product...I've also owned Note 10.1 it has more freedom for customization and apps. However, kindle is great if you're really linked in with Amazon...hopefully they'll update their app store, I'm use to having all my Google Apps on my devices.Now kindle is very smooth nice and clean interface. My browser is pretty fast also and I think I use kindle more than my Note 3. I recommend purchasing a stylus pen because it really is a wonderful addition.Originally I had purchased a Galaxy Tab 3 7.0 and immediately returned it and was gonna purchase the Nexus 7. The Tab is very outdated and ugly. The sales rep at best buy recommended the kindle to me over the Nexus 7... played with the Nexus for about 30 to 60 seconds. Finally walked over to the kindle it was beautiful clean smooth and fast. Love at first sight....I was in love and wasn't leaving without it. Once home with it..disappointment hit. Wow, it's not customizable unless rooted was on the verge of returning it..but then something amazing happened. While reading one of my many books...noticed a play button...tapped it with  stylus and it began reading..so you could speed it up or slow it down...downloaded my financial apps,business then play apps...so my kindle is a winner!!!!! You won't be disappointed....believe me.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I love the new Kindle Fire HDX. I was really unsure about upgrading from the original Kindle Fire. My 1st gen was working well, but I read about the browser speed improvement and I wanted HD.  I am a Kindle Prime member, but I have to admit I have not been taking advantage of Instant Videos as I should. I use my Kindle for reading, checking out a few blogs, and playing very few games. I now spend more time with this Kindle because using it is so easy...no glitches.  One of the things I appreciate with the upgrade is the improved keyboard. You can easily find a comma. Some friends encouraged me to download some interactive games like Iconmania, Heads Up Charades, and True or False, which we have all played together. I watched a movie with very smooth streaming. Don't hesitate to buy the new Kindle Fire HDX!I bought a Poetic cover for the HDX and it's great.The speakers, volume button and power switch are all accessible and the magnetic cover puts the Kindle to sleep.

Reviews.Title: Kindle HDX 7 Second Gen.
Reviews.Author: Tony DeLisio
Reviews.Content: I owned the the first Kindle Fire and enjoyed it alot.  Still have it and its working great.  I got some got a little money for my birthday and Christmas and wanted to upgrade.  The HDX had everything I was looking for..  When I received it I could not believe the improvements.  The sound quality is great.  I was working on it all night setting up my email, contacts and calendar.  Lets say I used up all my money to get this and it was worth every cent.  I looked at the Google but all the others look like a big phone.  I wanted something with a different look and feel.  I give it two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: instructions
Reviews.Author: Taryn Gahagan
Reviews.Content: Needs to come with some kind of instructions, not just young people who enjoy reading from such devices. A lot of younger kids use such devices more than older, but being a little older it's sometimes harder to just pick it up. I know I can use mayday and will do so I'm sure more than the younger kids.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Jesse
Reviews.Content: Order came quickly and on time (Christmas Eve).  It takes a little getting use to. Quit different from the iPad(more user friendly) however, the quad core makes loading extremely fast. Downloading app takes about 15-20 seconds. Very nice.
