Reviews.Content: I only got this today. The color is amazing!I did download some puff files I cannot find on the Adobe app but their in here somewhere. I'm sure I'll figure it out.Mobile files downloaded great. My books were on I n seconds that I'll had on a kindle app. It's not too heavy not extremely light either. Nice size as I have a tablet and a nook tablet. I like the size of this a lot better and the screen.It's just so bright and vivid. I really haven't used  it for anything else yet but I bet games are amazing.I definitely recommend. I have a HD tablet and this HDX blows the color away. Usage is easy and starts up easily not a lot of work.out of the box which I always dread.  Battery seems to hold well. I've been reading for about 4  hrs and it's half drained. If your considering buying just do it you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 7" HDX 16GB
Reviews.Author: Lathanette Creasman
Reviews.Content: Ok I am not a techy person but like to keep up with what the new gadgets are. I never buy technical toys as I call them. Family has been trying to get me to get one of these for over a year. Well, I LOVE IT!!!! I got it because I am in a bookclub and everyone uses theirs to for their books and other avenues. I am still a paperbook fan but I love the Kindle Fire HDX. Best investment I have done since a laptop.

Reviews.Title: Bright and Light
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: The screen is truly fantastic but the first thing I noticed was how light the device was. It blows my mind how they can pack such technology in such a small package. I am very happy with this purchase and highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: My favorite Kindle
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I love my newest Kindle.  This is very fast, very user friendly. I recently lost my laptop, but since I have been using this tablet, I won't replace the laptop.  I have a desktop computer when I want a keyboard, or a big screen for movies.  But, this tablet is fantastic for everything else, all the time, any time.  I check email, watch movies, read books, listen to music. LOVE IT!  I took it to school and let my 5th graders take turns using it for independent reading time.  It made reading so much fun for them. I also used a timer app in class as well.  The battery life is good on this tablet.  I use my other kindles, but this is my favorite one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Oceansky
Reviews.Content: So far I am loving my Kidle Fire HDX.  It is fast on its downloads and I'm still playing with it to get to know all it's features.

Reviews.Title: love it!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "aunt carol of 4"
Reviews.Content: I had one of the original Kindle Fires - which I love & still have.  I just wanted to upgrade to the newest available Kindle Fire. I've had it about a week now & it is even better than I hoped for.  I can now keep my laptop in the office b/c the web capabilities are so much better.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet.
Reviews.Author: paigewild
Reviews.Content: Great tablet its just as good if not better than the Nexus Tablet. I Luv it..... This tablet is a must buy......

Reviews.Title: Should have got the 64GB
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Milo"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from the original 8GB fire to the the HDX with 32GB and my only regret is not getting the 64GB.  I mostly use the Fire for reading, audiobooks, and podcasts.Negatives: No SD card reader.  No pre-installed podcasting app.Positives:  Nice hardware specs.  Fast, thin, and sharp.

Reviews.Title: Just got mine today
Reviews.Author: Ryan Kohlhaas
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a gift this Christmas. I bought it on the first day of Cyber Monday when it was 50$ off and honestly if you know how good the HDX is as a tablet in itself...it is totally worth it.I was alittle scared when I received my package today because it looked squashed. Amazon can't help the parcels journey but they put the Kindle in a tiny box with no protection like  bubble wrap etc. I turned it on to make sure everything worked and it is fantastic. The processor is super fast ( Better version of the new Nexus' 7), the screen is beautiful ( better than the iPad Air ) and it is barely 11 oz. in weight.I read alot of negative reviews about a "defect" with the lighting on the screen. If you do your research, the Kindle uses blue LEDs instead of white. The blue backlight in the device allows less power consumption and it provides the screen with a vibrant crisp image.The bottom line is, If you are getting a tablet as a gift this season, right now at this price, it doesn't get any better. The Kindle Fire HDX is a tablet that is proving to out do Apple and Google. If you are tech savy you can side load Google Apps or even root the device now. Anyone who says otherwise is delusional

Reviews.Title: Kindle HDX is OKX!
Reviews.Author: Robb Sinert
Reviews.Content: Wow. More than I expected. Faster than my desktop. Learning all the swipe techniques and enjoying it so far. One week owner.

Reviews.Title: Nay-sayers be damned. This Tablet Sings!
Reviews.Author: JiggsKC
Reviews.Content: I've found that many of the gripes about this tablet have an easy work-around. it's very fast, fluid, and feels great in the hand. The screen is gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: GOOD PURCHASE!!!!
Reviews.Author: L. Vanness "VERY HAPPY"
Reviews.Content: WELL needless to say my husband loves his new toy.  It is great he now has some place to read books and do email, so he is very happy, does not talk much to me but he is fine.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture!
Reviews.Author: J. Jones
Reviews.Content: The picture is absolutely amazing!  Only wish I would have got the 64gb instead of the 32.  The HD downloaded movies and shows are taking up alot of room.

Reviews.Title: Amazing for the money!
Reviews.Author: Tre
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my dad for Christmas and I've been playing with it and I must say I think they did a great job with this one. Especially if you aren't very tech savy this tablet is great.

Reviews.Title: Fun Device
Reviews.Author: Joan McCormick
Reviews.Content: Only have had this a few days, but have grown attached to it :)  This is my first electronic device other than my sell phone and computer.  Love how easy it is to use and also very easy to read books on.  The picture quality is outstanding!  Only problem is now I get carried away relaxing with all the activities it offers and don't get my work done :)

Reviews.Title: Great Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: Smcswiney
Reviews.Content: I never been a huge fan of tablets but I really like this product. My boyfriend got it for me as a early Christmas gift even though I didn't want it and now I take it everywhere with me.

Reviews.Title: This was a great purchase
Reviews.Author: Trudy McGuire
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love it.  The picture is great, I have to fight the kids to get a chance to use it.  Its small enough to bring with me every where I go.  I even bought each of my kids one of their own so I can use mine!

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Uhura
Reviews.Content: Very Handy, light weight and fits perfectly in my purse.  Sometimes myipad is too large,  the Kindle Fire HDX 7" is the perfect size.

Reviews.Title: Love my new tablet
Reviews.Author: footloose 321
Reviews.Content: It was so hard making a decison on a tablet. I bought the color nook years ago and thought I didn't need to upgrade. I coulnd't decide between the ipad mini and the fire hdx.  I chose the later and I love it. It is so clear and crisp.  I like all the free stuff amazon offers with it.  Great buy.

Reviews.Title: I really like it.
Reviews.Author: cw4ret@msn.com
Reviews.Content: Clear, sharp, and fast.  Only weakness might be short battery life and long charging times compared to other Kindle readers.

Reviews.Title: Nice product, seems like it's going to work out well for our needs
Reviews.Author: Bruce Lawson
Reviews.Content: Nice item fast shipping, seems like it's gonna work out well for our needs, may buy another one in the future

Reviews.Title: best tablet ever!
Reviews.Author: Bridget K Ament
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the kindle fire. I always wanted a tablet and this one goes above and beyond my expectations!_

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet
Reviews.Author: Jason Mallett
Reviews.Content: Best tablet ever. The interface is beautiful. Screen resolution is great. Can't express how awesome this thing is. Love Prime too.

Reviews.Title: Love the new HDX - it
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Works great, always nice to see an updated model.  Fast and super clear pictures.  Works exceptionally well with streaming videos.

Reviews.Title: loving it!!
Reviews.Author: Paula Renee Klepac
Reviews.Content: I really like this device!!!! I am an Apple girl but this little device has got me inspired to try other things!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great product!! iPad mini rival for sure!!
Reviews.Author: Katia Zahn
Reviews.Content: Great product!! Quad core processor screams along and runs any app perfectly! Better deal than an iPad mini for sure!

Reviews.Title: The value and quality of the 7" Kindle Fire HDX can't be beat
Reviews.Author: carpenocturne
Reviews.Content: In the tablet market, you can't beat the value regarding price on the Kindle Fire HDX. The picture quality is excellent and is perfect for viewing movies, videos and pictures. I do a lot of reading and the screen is perfect for that too. Combine all of this with the vast selections of Amazon.com and you have a near perfect device for all of your portable entertainment needs. There aren't as many app choices as Apple but all the most in demand apps are available and I've already gotten many of them. All apps, videos, music and books open and close very quickly. The only drawback I can see for some people is that you can't change the lock screen picture on your own without rooting your Kindle which I will not do but this isn't important to me. There is a revolving series of programmed pictures on the lock screen which also shows the time, and the home screen is solid black.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing purchase - defective device
Reviews.Author: Venketaram R.
Reviews.Content: The Kindle I received ended up being defective. Unfortunately, downloads of any apps, purchases, etc. never went through and left the placeholders for the apps unable to be closed. Given that I had previously strongly considered purchasing a Kindle, this was a disappointing and frustrating ordeal.However, I give this review an extra star for the excellent help provided to me via MayDay in trying to troubleshoot my device.

Reviews.Title: Great unit but has video issues
Reviews.Author: michael bolte
Reviews.Content: The unit has a great display, camera has great clarity but there is a problem with it when used with Skype the video has about a second delay over the sound.  Also the unit reboot itself about once a day.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Donna Braxton
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire! The colors are vibrant and clear, and the programs are user friendly. My granddaughter also enjoys it, and I don't have to worry about what she might get into with the kids programming. My biggest problem is getting it away from her so that I can use it!

Reviews.Title: This is an awesome tablet
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: it is the best tablet around. only draw back is the one camera, hard to take good pics. Get one today

Reviews.Title: Excellent device
Reviews.Author: John Wuk
Reviews.Content: Works flawlessly.  Extremely fast WiFi connection.  Screen is top notch.  Light weight and great size for travel.  Easy to sideload apps.  Waiting for PS 4 to be added so I can try second screen.  Connects so much faster than my laptop find myself using it for most of my browsing.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Melanie
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice tablet for the price and my Grandchildren love it too! Very kid friendly! They are each getting their own for Christmas!

Reviews.Title: I threw my Xyborg out after trying this.
Reviews.Author: Marge90601 "Dog Lover"
Reviews.Content: Fast to connect to wifi, responsive keypad and screen, extra features not available on other wifi tablets, ads not intrusive, haven't even started enjoying all the features. But as soon as I started it up and got on my email, I got rid of my Motorola Xyborg which was very unresponsive, difficult to type on, hard to connect with.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7" HDX
Reviews.Author: Marianne Nyberg
Reviews.Content: Love the new kindle HDX.  Clarity is very sharp although still a little hard to read in the sun.  (Maybe too sharp).  Still learning all the functions.  Wish there was a way to down load a full manual, vs sections at a time.Hard to sync pictures from an android phone.Not as easy to find the prime books and movies available, but with the help of the mayday button, you easily learn.Glad I up graded.

Reviews.Title: My second kindle.
Reviews.Author: Lori A. Brown "labrown"
Reviews.Content: Just got it within a week and a half ago. Still learning about what it can do. Love it so far.

Reviews.Title: love the upgrade
Reviews.Author: larryl
Reviews.Content: I have the kindle fire hd from last year and bought the hdx from best buy because it was on sell. I wasn't going to upgrade until I experienced it at the store. I thought surely this demo unit can't be how the real one is. I was wrong. I have an iPad 4 (work provided), Motorola Xoom, galaxy tab 2, original kindle fire, fire hd, Toshiba thrive, and now the HDX and I can say without a doubt I have never ever ever experienced a tablet this fast and smooth. The iPad is smooth but not instant. I even tried the nexus 7 at best buy and nope. I feel like the hd speakers are a little better than this, but not much. Other than that I'm extremely pleased in this device and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Mayday works and so does this tablet!
Reviews.Author: Dwight Daugherty
Reviews.Content: I have had my 7" kindle HDX for about one month.  I couldn't be more pleased.  The screen is sharp as advertised.  It is light and easy to handle.  The only drawback is the light blue border when the screen is white.  Frankly it doesn't really bother me.  I did use the May day button to remove a popup screen I kept getting.  I was answered within 30 seconds, problem fixed within 3 minutes!  Wow!!!!  I haven't encountered anything this tablet can't handle.I am very pleased and would recommend this tablet to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Worthy upgrade from the HD
Reviews.Author: C. Winton "cwinton"
Reviews.Content: My first Kindle was the electronic ink version, which had the huge advantage of running for weeks on a single charge if you turned off communications.  Over the next 4 years I purchased the Kindle Fire, the Kindle Fire HD, and now the Kindle Fire HDX (64Gb), all 7" models.  Each Fire model has been a significant improvement over its predecessor, although of course none come remotely close to the battery life of the electronic ink models.  That being said, as a reader, battery life for all the Fire models is fine for those long airplane trips, where you have the bonus of the device playing music while you read.  Other reviewers have covered battery life for those willing to watch movies on such a small screen.  Being able to mirror movies from Amazon Prime onto my TV is good enough for my purposes.So what else is noticeably improved?  First off, the HDX is noticeably thinner, lighter, and faster.  Second, if your email requires VPN, there is an integrated VPN client that is almost trivial to set up (you may have to download the Thor OS upgrade for this, I did).  The provided email app connected easily for me. and I found new versions of apps I typically use, such as ES File Explorer and a really good (free) SSH terminal emulation app that works great on the HDX.I debated long and hard as to whether an upgrade from my HD was advisable at this time, and finally decided to take the plunge.  I'm glad I did.  The HDX is living up to the hype.  I even found the help feature useful.  It connected immediately to a knowledgeable individual who pointed me to the need to upgrade the OS in order to get the VPN client.

Reviews.Title: Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Bobbe
Reviews.Content: Loved the original Kindle Fire, this one is better.  This version is faster and brighter.  I am glad I upgraded.

Reviews.Title: e
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with the new kindle fire hdx.  I've only had it a little over 3 weeks.  Since I had it.  it constantly loses my wi-fi singnal (at least 2-3 times per day). Then to get it to reconnect I have to stand right next to my router.  This has become very annoying.  The other issue I am having is random shutdowns of my kindle for no reason.  It doesn't matter if I am in the middle of something on the kindle or not.  I have contacted support about these problems.  He did everything he could to help and then said he would have to contact the managers and he would keep me posted by email.  He sent a few emails telling me he was working on the problem and the last email I received stated his superiors said I should update my kindle with the new update because it would fix my problems..  I think he had forgotten we had already checked that and my kindle was up to date.  Therefore, I am no longer receiving any more emails about this issue which means the problems are not fixed and now I don't know what to do about it.  I have had 3 other kindles prior to this and have never had a problem.  I have the kindle for reading with the keyboard, kindle 1st generation, and the kindle fire 7" hd.  The only one purchased from Amazon is the new kindle fire 7" HDX  which I was very excited to receive and now I am having these issues.  I am especially disappointed that my problems have now been written off.  I am going to contact support again to see if they can help.

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: tmr
Reviews.Content: picture quality, speed, size  only thing I miss is google play store but I have that on my 10" Toshiba  thrive.

Reviews.Title: Kindle LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Rae Jean
Reviews.Content: I love it.  This is one purchase I am glad I made.  I can check e-mails, facebook, read, play games.  LOVE IT

Reviews.Title: As versatile as a laptap or tablet.
Reviews.Author: Lorene Wilkerson
Reviews.Content: I love this because it substitutes for my laptop and is easier to carry with me in my purse.  I can receive emails and have documents sent to it which assists me at meetings.

Reviews.Title: amazingly easy to use
Reviews.Author: Jaime
Reviews.Content: Amazing! Easy to use. The colours are brilliant! I did not notice the blue tint or glow others described. Can't wait to watch more movies and tv! Great buy!

Reviews.Title: New kindle
Reviews.Author: Frank Latchford
Reviews.Content: Very nice and love it! This kindle is nicer than my old one! Much clearer especially for when I am playing my games!

Reviews.Title: Great Kindle!
Reviews.Author: Sharon Mcclellan "Garden Nana"
Reviews.Content: I really like this Kindle Fire HDX.  Great for travel.  I can access my accounts, read a book, enjoy Facebook and much, much more while traveling.  Much better than lugging around a big laptop.

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: Robert B. Miller
Reviews.Content: This unit is more powerful than my original Fire. I can surf the web more easily, and playing videos and music is a dream.

Reviews.Title: Apps
Reviews.Author: Joseph J DeLeone
Reviews.Content: I really like Kindle.  Some of the apps that I like have not worked. I am still learning how to utilize all it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: Like the Product But Concerned About Quality of Hardware (had to get a replacement after a week of use)
Reviews.Author: Scott Gill
Reviews.Content: I've had my Kindle HDX for about a week now, and I had to call and get a replacement today. The Kindle won't charge. It will turn on as long as it's plugged into a power source, but as soon as I unplug the device, it shuts down due to low battery. They are sending me a replacement that should be here in a couple of days, but it leaves me to question the quality of the hardware on the new Kindle, in general. I wonder what will happen six months or a year down the road with my replacement.That said, I love the product for the week that I was able to use it. Love the interface, the picture quality, and the look and feel of the device. There are a few apps that I have on my Android phone that aren't available in the Kindle App store (like ESPN Fantasy Football), but I'm sure that more apps will be added over time.In conclusion: I like the product, but I'm concerned about the quality of the device hardware.

Reviews.Title: Very good buy
Reviews.Author: goal13keep
Reviews.Content: This is a great buy for the money. Much much faster than the original Kindle Fire. It's a great size and weight, and an excellent price. Overall I'm very happy with the way it functions. My only complaint is that the app store seems to be lacking some. I haven't been able to get some of the apps that I use on my other devices. The ads that show up on the lock screen are a bit annoying, but not overtly bothersome (as soon as you unlock to get to your main screen, the ads are gone).I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet - fast and high picture quality
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "shaoli"
Reviews.Content: Kindle fire hdx is a very good device. I like its wifi speed. It is faster than my iPad mini. The iPad mini paused a lot when I use it in my kitchen; the kindle fire hdx does not. Also picture quality of the kindle device is much better. It has a fluid key board too. Typing on screen is smooth and effortless. (Foreign language key board input is easy to set up.) I install apps by just searching on the internet with silk browser and install the android tablet comparable version. Of course you can go to the App Store to install apps if there are any. I have both App Store found apps and internet found apps installed. It is just like a powerful mini PC. One thing I would like to mention is that I do not see the blue edge issue at all. When I use my apps, the picture quality is superb. No distraction what so ever.

Reviews.Title: Great to have this gadget
Reviews.Author: Aldrich Farrel Saputra
Reviews.Content: Really love this kindle version, high end spec with a reasonable price. Technically speaking this was a good deal for me, the sound, the display, the reading experience is superb. even though i feel a bit frustrated with the region restriction.

Reviews.Title: laughing at auto correct!
Reviews.Author: a.seas
Reviews.Content: Love my new HDX7, camera ready,lots of fun,love the tech support , have used it  twice now! Both times the service was excellent,  And the price is great, for the HDX 7 , auto correct can get a bit annoying, but you do get good laughs from it.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: So far it is great. It's a lot better on the battery life also. I like the slim design and it seems to move a lot better

Reviews.Title: Blue haze is very distracting
Reviews.Author: RandomReader
Reviews.Content: Please be aware of the blue haze on the border of the screen.  According to Amazon the haze is an unavoidable side effect of the screen architecture, meaning it can't be fixed.  If you use any app with a white background (books, web, etc) this will become an unacceptable distraction.Other than that the device is great. One fatal flaw, however, still spells doom.

Reviews.Title: Overall: Below Expectations
Reviews.Author: CD
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, I purchased this because of price. As my first pseudo-Android tablet, I found it to be a very limited tablet based on Apps available and limitations on installing true Android apps, including a real internet browser.Battery life for active use seems to be as-advertised; however I do not expect the batteries to fully drain while in sleep mode - this is the case with my unit.Screen quality is superb for a 7" tablet - the blue-haze issue on the borders is somewhat annoying when reading books.  Sound quality is second to none when compared to my other tablets.  Mayday is a cool feature - in a couple of instances I received great support and help; in others, it was anything but helpful.I am not a Prime subscriber - even that has limitations over other alternative media providers. This further convinced me not to subscribe.Overall, my disappointment stems from the limitation enforced with the Android apps available (c'mon, no YouTube or real Browser?), the questionable battery life when not in use, and the blue haze of this otherwise great display.Finally, I saw a recent TV ad comparing the HDX to an iPad... If anything, that ad is pushing me AWAY from any future Kindle purchases - you truly get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: love it.
Reviews.Author: justin
Reviews.Content: My family and I.own an iPad air, three kindles, several iPhones... you get the point.  For the money, this is far and away the one I consider the best.  Other tablets have their points, but this little guy does everything I can throw at it and more.  Unless you plan on dropping a ton of cash, the fire HDX can't be beat.Only issue I've had with it is I wish the kindle app.store was as extensive as their competitors.

Reviews.Title: Great technology, poor marketing
Reviews.Author: Victoria Hudson
Reviews.Content: The device worked right out of the box. Screen quality is stunning and video amazing. With the origami case there is some heft to the device and over time a unsupported hand holding it would tire. The origami case is a creative solution that works fairly well as a functional case btw. The help capability to instantly video chat with a tech is a positive experience. My Kindle arrived with special offers enabled, though I'd ordered without them. An email to customer support resulted in a reply within a couple hours, on Christmas Eve no less, with the sponsored ads removed, no charge. Incidentally, I think it would be useful if there was a way to opt back in for that content in order to receive the special offers in an unobtrusive manner. If this was controllable by the user that might be useful.I rate the poor marketing due to the following information in the product description: "Stay productive on the go with ultra-fast web browsing, built-in OfficeSuite, and updated e-mail and calendar support for Gmail, Outlook, and more"There is no built-in OfficeSuite. There is a built-in VIEWER.  A viewer is a very different product from an office suite. One can read documents but not be very productive if unable to produce documents, spreadsheets or presentations. This in my mind is just false and misleading advertising. A deciding factor in purchasing this product was the presence of a built-in office suite tool. You won't even know this either, unless you go looking on the product forum, as I and others have done, posting "where is the built-in OfficeSuite? That should tell Amazon something - consumers are expecting a true suite of office tools. Either include one or more accurately portray what is on board.I chose this device after one too many crashes with my first gen iPad. So far, I'm happy with the technology. It's intuitive, easy to use and the images on the screen are exceedingly clear and sharp. Set-up was easy and fast. The very simple on board customer service is in strong contrast to getting help from Apple, which is no where near as easy. That's a definite positive factor for this product. I do not however like a leading advertised facet of the product to turn out as misleading particularly when that facet is what helped me decide to give this alternative technology a try.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: GCP
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a christsmas gift.  So far we love it!  Was very easy to set up and start using immediatly.

Reviews.Title: Sweet!!!
Reviews.Author: Tim Whippo
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from the original Kindle Fire.Compared to the original Kindle Fire, the HDX 7" is noticeably lighter and easier to hold.The quad core processor is very, very fastHDX display is awesome!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7" HDX problems
Reviews.Author: June Wiatroski
Reviews.Content: I received my kindle HDX on 12/11/13. I have called 4 times with freezing problems.  lcons that were deleted still appeared on home screen .  I spoke to  tech who was hard to understand. After close to an hour,  I requested to talk to a manager. I had to go back to factory default. For a new Kindle  I should not have to do this and freezing problems should not be happening.If this continues I want a new Kindle 7" HDX.review written 12/22/13

Reviews.Title: Perfect tablet except for google integration
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This tablet is the best 7" tablet available.  Its lighter and the battery lasts longer than the new nexus 7 and I personally think the screen has better color reproduction and contrast.  I had both and compared side by side, the Kindle was just all around better.  HOWEVER, no access to google voice, hangouts, maps, Music, keep, gmail, docs, google calendar, and chrome makes this tablet limited in its awesomeness.  I use a laptop for most of my internet and "productivity" related tasks so no integration with the google ecosystem isn't a deal breaker for me.  But it sure would be nice to be able to have hangouts, keep, maps, and voice.  Almost 100% of my IMing happens in hangouts or facebook chat, neither of which are in the Amazon market, and I would love to check my texts with google voice on the tablet.  No gmail, chrome, docs, or calendar isn't a big deal because the substitutes they have are good enough, and no music is understandable because Amazon has their own music app BUT for light social applications and looking at Maps I really wish amazon would make a deal with Google or create  decent native apps that integrates with them.With that being said, I still like the HDX 7" better than the nexus 7 tablet because of the seamless integration with the amazon ecosystem and amazing access to content through prime. Its so easy to watch movies, play games, read comics, and read books that what little leisure time I have is spent within the amazon ecosystem.  Movie/television integration is easier and more convenient than netflix on android and books look as good as they can on a tablet.  Great product!

Reviews.Title: I recommend this highly to everyone for every need and want :)
Reviews.Author: Debbie "Let your smile change the world, not ...
Reviews.Content: I teach computers and tech to people with different needs and I haven't found anyone that this isn't the perfect answer :)  So far I have 4 clients and 3 family members I have "convinced" to get one.  I only wish I had one too :)  My turn will come soon I know it will :)  Maybe Amazon will give me a credit for all the Fires I help sell and I will buy one with that :)  So just incase let them know my review helped you decide :)  I am kidding :)  only about the credit.  I am very serious about how wonderful the Fire is and how useful it is for just about everything and everyone :)  Please ask questions before buying to make sure because you want to be so happy when the box arrives that it makes you so excited for at least a month or two :) :) :)

Reviews.Title: Totally recommend!
Reviews.Author: wcfbrat
Reviews.Content: I had the first generation kindle and loved it.  I chose this new kindle because of its weight and battery life expectancy and I have not been disappointed.  The visual display is so clear and the criticism of the blue tinge on the outskirts of the display screen is not noticeable and does not take away the reading pleasure.  Overall, I am totally satisfied with this product and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great updated Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Jean Farmer "gizzmogeek"
Reviews.Content: Replaced an original generation Kindle Fire with the new HDX Kindle Fire and it's awesome. Faster, brighter, better picture. Nothing to complain about. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Mayday!
Reviews.Author: Kris Cantu
Reviews.Content: For those of you that haven't had to use the new Mayday feature know that it is awesome.  I got my KF HDX today and had a couple account registration issues to sort out.  I went into the help feature and next thing I know their was real live person on a mini "skype" screen who walked me through what I needed to do.  She could even "highlight and circle" where I needed to go to do it.  Way cool!

Reviews.Title: Deal breaker issues
Reviews.Author: boomer
Reviews.Content: I've had two HDX 7s in a week, and they both exhibit three issues that I can't overlook.1) blue light bleeding - for me too distracting in web pages, reading, etc. I can't train myself to ignore it2) wifi - I have two access points in my house, and the Fire can't hold a signal. 90% of the time I have to turn my wifi off then on to rejoin my network3) battery drain in standby. Maybe related to wifi hunting, but leaving device in standby all day drains my battery from 100% to 40% in about 10 hrsI wanted to like this for the screen, simplicity, and Prime features, but in the end, I'll try the nexus or just default to the mini.

Reviews.Title: No HDMI mini Connection!
Reviews.Author: DaMann4u
Reviews.Content: Before I tell why I gave this three stars you most understand that this is my fourth kindle and my third kindle fire hd and my first kindle HDX so I have some history with Amazon kindle products. The reason why I moved to the HDX is because I needed I much bigger hard drive. My other kindle fires are 16 gb and they became to small very quickly when I started storing HD movies. A major draw back and disappointment for the HDX is that you cannot connect a hdmi mini cable to it and watch on a bigger television. No HDMI mini connection. That's a bummer!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!
Reviews.Author: S. E. Hochstetler
Reviews.Content: love, love, love my hdx. I have the kindle keyboard, i have the kindle fire and now i have the hdx. the grapics are great! it is faster, lighter. It has some great new features like mayday and mirror...

Reviews.Title: Disappointing when compared to past Kindle Fire's and the current crop of 7-inch Tablets
Reviews.Author: Ken Z. "kzVegas"
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers I'm a heavy tablet user and I can setup several tablets next to one another to compare strengths and weaknesses.  I have currently:1.) Kindle Fire (1st Gen.)2.) Kindle Fire HD 8.3 (2nd Gen.)3.) Kindle Fire HDX (3rd Gen Fire)4.) iPad Air  (5th Gen iPad)5.) iPad Mini with Retina Display (2nd Gen iPad Mini)6.) Google Nexus 7 (2013)7.) Nvidia Shield8.) ASUS Transformer TF-101First, let me say I think the Kindle Fire platform is really nice when compared to the straight-up Google android experience.  Amazon does a great job of bridging the technical gaps for a user wanting to use a tablet and not have to constantly enter their email and password.  The Amazon docs, photos, music and video compare better in use to Apple's iCloud experience and makes the Amazon prime a solid investment.  Additionally, the horsepower of the Kindle HDX is amazing and makes this tablet for the holiday 2013 season a solid gaming platform.  My own benchmarking of the Kindle Fire HDX shows that gaming performance and CPU performance place this unit within the same performance bracket as the current generation of iPads and the Nvidia sheild.  Which is saying something when the HDX is half the cost of an iPad mini and 2/3rds the cost of a Nvidia shield.My disappointment comes from the screen on the Kindle fire HDX.  The HDX's screen shows a very visible and noticeable blue ring around the display's edge.  I've measured the blue ring to be one-eighth of inch along the long edges of the screen and slightly less on the short edges of the screen.  These blue edges really become notable when you are reading a book or browsing a web page that have white page backgrounds.  The blue ringing is much less noticeable when viewing the carousel page (which are grey) or running a app that uses something darker around the edges.I can not recommend the Kindle Fire HDX to my friends, family and colleagues because of what I consider to be design defect in the screen.  This blue ring is not apparent on either my Kindle Fire or Kindle Fire HD 8.9 or other tablets that I have.

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet Ever!!!!
Reviews.Author: janell2012np
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new Kindle Fire HDX! It's the most amazing tablet ever. The mayday feature is a lifesaver. And you barely have to wait for someone to help you. The person is nice, but the better part is that they actually know what they are doing. I wouldn't trade my Kindle in the world! I always carry it with me!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Andrew V.
Reviews.Content: The only negative I've found after 4 days use is the inability to play Flash video.  Unfortunately Adobe no longer offers Flash Player for Android.

Reviews.Title: No HDMI or USB Hosting
Reviews.Author: Derick
Reviews.Content: Great screen, fast and responsive.  The new features in the Mojito OS are terrific additions and make owning a Kindle Fire much more rewarding.  Its everything you could want out of a tablet...except for two things.There's no HDMI port.  It didn't even occur to me to look for this, the old Kindle Fire HD has it, so I guess I thought it would be a given.  Instead it relies on Miracast.  Miracast is supposed to be like a wireless HDMI standard, but you have to buy a $50+ device to make it work.  The other thing missing from this is USB hosting, which is present in every Android 3.1+ device.  I wanted to use my Kindle Fire HDX to upload photos from my camera to Facebook and the like while I was out on vacation by using a Micro USB SD Card Reader.The no HDMI thing doesn't bug me as much as the USB thing, I really wanted to be able to look at my vacation photos on my Kindle Fire HDX while I was out on vacation.  To be honest, if I hadn't bought this on Cyber Monday I would be returning it for a Nexus 7 for just this one thing.  Maybe its a software limitation that Amazon can fix, I don't know, but I hope it is, and they do indeed fix it.

Reviews.Title: Regarding Blue Light.....
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Regarding blue light........I poured through all the reviews on this device, so I was well aware of the negativity surrounding the blue light used in the Kindle.  I would say this:  If your intended use of this device is to read Kindle books, I would run away.  Far away.  Go with the black&white; Kindle.  But, if you plan on doing just about anything else, the Kindle HDX is an excellent choice.  You'll never notice the blue edges, except for maybe web pages.What blew me away most about the Kindle was the sound.  I have had every iPad since day 1 and have always just accepted the speaker quality.  I'll still use my iPad simply because of all the Apps I already enjoy, but for movies and TV shows I'll go to the Kindle every time.  Amazing sound.  Why can't Apple do this with the iPad?Bottom line is:  Buy it. It is well worth the money.  I bought the one with the ads and they don't really bother me at all.  They are tailored to what you look at and or purchase on Amazon, so I don't mind that marketing approach.

Reviews.Title: First Kindle - LAFS...
Reviews.Author: Birdleganger
Reviews.Content: So far so good!  The unit itself is cute.  My youngest is enjoying the free games -- haven't had any issues with any of the programs yet -- battery life is pretty good though we have to charge it every day (maybe it isn't that good, I don't know.  This is our first Kindle).Shipping was wicked fast.  Even with buying it on Thanksgiving night...we had it by Monday.  Then lo and behold a few days later it was (of course) an additional $50 off.  Quick online chat with Kindle customer service (about 7 minutes) and BAM!  $50 refunded and an email confirmation thanking me for allowing them to refund me $50 LOL!Set up was cake -- less than 5 minutes and we were off and rolling.  Amazon sent an email the day it was delivered with links to everything we needed.  Unit moves through any program we throw at it with ease.  Videos/movies - games - web sites are all quick and crystal clear.  Haven't tried all it has to offer yet -- but I see no reason to worry  I have no complaints. The one I did have (price drop) got taken care immediately.I'm certain some people do have problems -- but rather than run to Amazon reviews to complain -- most sane people at least contact Amazon first to try to fix the problem.  I get so tired of the negative reviews that say "all these positive reviews are made up/fake because I had problems with mine!" I tend to lean along the lines that someone who is that paranoid and angry/bitter/nasty about it is not going to be a credible source for my buying choices.Very Happy!  Great unit - so glad we finally got one!!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful colors and crisp display but no miccro HDMI slot!
Reviews.Author: Sue Boyle "blue9244"
Reviews.Content: I would probably give this 5 stars if they hadn't decided, in their infinite wisdom, to remove the micro HDMI outlet.  I had a Fire HD and used it to stream Amazon Prime movies to my TV.  Now I can't do that.  I gave my older Kindle to my daughter and I am left with nothing that I can stream to my TV.  I bought a Netgear Push2TV but that did not work.  I spent hours with the rep from Netgear trying to get it up and running.Otherwise the new Kindle has better battery power and the screen is amazing.  The colors are vivid and games are a joy to play.  I would highly recommend the HDX if you don't care about streaming movies.  It's also quite light-weight.  All in all, I love it!  I just wish I could stream movies and TV shows to my big (now useless) TV set.

Reviews.Title: Nice product
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have all of the Kindle Fire models. This version is improved over last years. The screen and sound are amazing! I did compare side by side and there is noticeable clarity in the picture quality playing a movie. The set up was very fast, love that the charger is included this year. The Kindle came already registered to me, saving time in setup. I have not set up email yet but previous versions worked fine. The wi fi connected very fast, an improvement from the HD model, where at times I have had to turn the kindle off and on to get a connection.  This is slightly smaller and lighter than the HD version. That is not a plus to me because I like the wider edge on the HD. So an old case will not fit. What I do not like is the rearranged buttons for power and volume! They are located on the back side and the kindle will require a specialized case in order to access them if it is being used in the case. They also did away with the HDMI port ! I use that feature on my original HD model frequently. Also the cable port is at an angle and off to one side. This is probably because the device is so thin. It compares to the I pad mini, but the mini has a larger viewing area.  If you have last years model I would keep it. If you do not own a Fire yet you will not be dissatisfied with the HDX.  I have not tried out the camera, I am already spoiled with the I pad mini camera which is wonderful, so it does not make a difference that the Kindle has one.  My favorite feature is Amazon Prime videos, and the speakers.  This is an excellent device for the price! I give it  only 4 stars because of the button location and no HDMI plug in option.

Reviews.Title: I like it, but...
Reviews.Author: Catherine Smith
Reviews.Content: have decided to return it. The tablet itself is great, but apps and customization are limited due to it being a heavily modified version of Android and is too tightly integrated with Amazon products. It's still more of a reader than a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Very good bang for the buck.  Looks great, fast and easy to use.
Reviews.Author: MikeR
Reviews.Content: I was an owner of the first kindle way back when they cost a crazy amount (about $500) and it was a big clunky ereader but it did its job and I was impressed with its technology (I work in IT so I am a tech / gadget guy).  Since then I have tried out different tablets, smart phones and computers and over the years I have been buying more and more Apple products (I currently have the 5s, Ipad 3rd Gen and MacBook Air) and I still think Apple makes a hell of a product but my wife and I also still enjoy our kindles.  I am also a Amazon Prime member so when I saw the new Fire HDX and the good reviews I thought I would give this "mini" a shot.  So far everything has worked very well and the first thing that pops out if the graphics...  they really pop and it is eye candy.  The second thing you notice is the speed, this little guy is fast and while I agree the application store is a little limited it does well with what is available (and I am sure since Amazon is selling a lot of these things that the developers will make many more and ensure popular Apps from other devices are also offered on this...  might just take a little time for them to show up).  The third thing I noticed is the OS is clean and user friendly.  Some people might think its basic or limited but they have a very common sense approach on how to get to all the content.  when I was using this I was thinking... if I was going to get a tablet for my parents or non tech savvy friends and family this would be it.  With the clean easy to use OS and the mayday  option I could see this being a cost effective option for many people.  I end up being the tech support person for my family when anything breaks or has an issue or just end user questions so I think this device would take care of most of that.  Also after trying this out the last few days I now notice the weight of my full size Ipad and while at home I still enjoy using my Ipad the HDX is what I grab when I walk out the door.  Its does everything I want when I am out and about but in a much smaller lighter easy to use bundle.  So if you picked this up for the Cyber Monday deal of $179 this guy has a lot of bang for the buck, if you already use a lot of apple devices I am sure the Apple Mini is just as good though it costs a little more but if you want to try something new, want something that is a little more cost effective or easy to use for the more technology impaired (or if you have Prime membership) then this is worth the shot.  Amazon also has a great return policy if for some reason you decide the HDX is not for you once you give it a shot.  I think it's a keeper and I might end up getting a few more for my Parents and In-laws as I think this is something they would enjoy and could handle that would cut out the ongoing IT support I usually have to provide ;-)

Reviews.Title: Incredible value, and just plain incredible.
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I am in awe. I have just unwrapped the Kindle 2 hours ago, and I am still marveling at the wealth of features that this tiny tablet continues to display.Value - 5/5Especially if you bought it during the $50 off promotion and are a Amazon Prime member (tons of free movies + borrow a free book every month). ~$179 for a kindle fire HDX 16GB (Less than half that of a similar iPad2 which goes for $399). It can do everything the iPad2 can, and better. Just compare the two models:kindle fire hdx student gaming tablet[...]- Much lighter (303g to iPad2's 601g, though iPad2 is slightly bigger)- More than double the pixel density (323ppi compared to iPad2's 132), meaning way better graphics for movies etc- Faster (2.2 Ghz Quad core processor compared to iPad2's 1Ghz dual-core)- Better audio (Dolby Digital Plus)- Better front camera (720p compared to iPad2's VGA - only advantage that iPad2 has is that it has a rear camera)- Instant LIVE help just on the touch of a button (Mayday)- AND MORE.I do not usually write reviews, however for a truly amazing product at a great price, I am motivated. Had Apple bought over this product and named it iPad Fire, it would easily have gone for $500 and above (yes the Apple brand name is worth that much.)Kudos to Amazon for filling me with wonder at the capabilities of technology. I'm off to feast my eyes upon the movies!

Reviews.Title: Great screen and Dolby sound, but plagued with wifi issues.
Reviews.Author: Anthony E. Thomas
Reviews.Content: I love the screen and love the awesome stereo speakers, but the HDX has wireless connection issues. My HDX continually drops wifi. Toggling the Airplane mode brings it back to life, but after 30-minutes or so, it drops again. The signal bars show full strength, but there is really no data being sent/received. Other people are reporting the same issue on the Kindle forums. I'm sure Amazon will work this out eventually, but I need a wireless tablet that works 'now'.

Reviews.Title: A very solid tablet for a good price
Reviews.Author: DD
Reviews.Content: After spending some time with the kindle HDX I have to admit that I am very impressed with it.  The screen crystal  clear and it is very easy to read  without any eye fatigue.  I am a prime member and I think that a prime membership is needed to get the most out of the Kindle.  I was disappointed with the video application because it is not easy to browse the videos by genre.  Also I would think that you should be able to filter out videos  with mature content or to quickly see which films are included in the instant video collection.  The audio quality on the kindle is great and very clear through it's speakers.  The seven inch model is very comfortable and fits my had very well.  Overall the Kindles just keep improveing as time goes on.  I just hope that amazon improves the amazon on demand app and adds the ability to download the instant prime videos to other devices.

Reviews.Title: you won't regret buying the Kindle HDX!!!
Reviews.Author: eraeand
Reviews.Content: Love it!!!! The "blue" outline around white pages is only noticeable because I read reviews talking about the blue so I looked for it...not hardly noticeable.  Bought the Poetic cover and its great!

Reviews.Title: simply amazing.
Reviews.Author: inspire
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this -- the display is great, the sound is great and the battery life is no joke either. I generally use it to play games downloaded from the kindle app store -- games which have bogged down or not been very visible when purchased or played on an android-based phone that has a smaller screen. I never thought I wanted a tablet until my best friend got this. I use it far more than she does: every night, in fact, reading up on the latest jobs on a favorite website, grabbing free titles from the kindle download store, and so on. This does everything I would want it to do. Kudos, amazon. Note: i haven't tried running spreadsheets or anything that requires extra software, but I do watch tv episodes directly from tv station websites. No problems!

Reviews.Title: Nice 7 inch tablet
Reviews.Author: Obee "Ob"
Reviews.Content: I really like the HDX,,all the fuss about the blue around the edge of the screen is crazy.You really have to look for it on a pure white screen to even notice it.I really don't understand what people want for a 200$ tablet,,I have a full size Ipad and sure it works like silk and is perfect but it also cost me 599$.I love this small tablet,I take it everwhere with me.If you are looking for a small tablet with the fastest processor out there and one of the best displays,,BUY THISThis is an update for the HDX,,,used it now for almost a month and I still love it.I also own a Nexus 7 2013 and the HDX beats it hands down,,Stuff to know,,the nexus 7 is about an inch and a half longer making it feel very big compared to the kindle..reviewers complain about the kindle being difficult to use do not want to try the nexus,,there are no directions at all in the pack and there is no help to call like the kindle.I have them both in a I blason cover which I can say is a very nice cover for both of them for the price.Performance wise the kindle and the nexus are close,both have beautiful screens,,but I have to say that the kindle has better sound.To let you know I only bought the nexus so I can use the google play store,,but have to say I still love the kindle,,and I am  still trying to see the blue edges after a month of use.I either got a very good kindle because its barely there after looking really hard to see it

Reviews.Title: Addicted great knowledge resource
Reviews.Author: Debra M
Reviews.Content: This is the coolest thing ever. I'm hooked. Books, tv, movies, games, e-mail and more. Awesome picture quality, sharp clean view.

Reviews.Title: GREAT KINDLE!
Reviews.Author: WIGirl
Reviews.Content: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE MY KINDLE!!! I have had it for about a week and I really LOVE it so far! Great Picture, Sound and has my email and everything right there when I open it! Awesome price too!

Reviews.Title: Review of new Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: davy gurley
Reviews.Content: Had older style Kindle Fire which I liked but some great reviews for the new HDX made me want to replace it--received it and getting used to new abilities it is able to do. Color and brightness are outstanding. Having the live help is great!!!--had to use it within an hour of set up and in 30 seconds my Genie in the box gave me the info and help I required.  Awesome!!

Reviews.Title: This is the tablet/ereader to get!
Reviews.Author: Chad Homme
Reviews.Content: My wife has had a Kindle for a while and I decided to get one.  This is nothing short of incredible.  Screen clarity is amazing, battery life is great.  Couldn't ask for a better reader/tablet.

Reviews.Title: It just gets better and better!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've had every single Kindle Fire, but this new HDX is, hands down, one of the most innovative tablets ever. The two best features are the Mayday button and the song lyrics. No tablet that I'm aware of has any support even close to the Mayday button. You simply tap the onscreen button and, voila, a person comes on your screen and helps you. A real person you can see. The can't see you, but they can see your screen. I've used it a couple of times and never waited more than 10-15 seconds before they were right there speaking to me. AMAZING!Second, the new rolling lyrics with your music is awesome, however,  not many songs have the lyrics yet. I'm sure they're working on the data base, but the more current songs are available. On some albums some songs are done but not all. Great idea and hopefully Amazon is bringing lyrics in quickly.And let's not forget xray for movies. Tap the screen and you'll get a pop-up with movie info like the names of which actors are on the screen at any given moment. Awesome!Awesome machine... If it just had front AND rear facing cameras it would be perfect. It does have front facing, but not rear. Try it you'll love it! I hope the Mayday button catches on across the industry because support is usually so difficult! Way to go Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Really good buy!
Reviews.Author: Marwan
Reviews.Content: I wanted a 7" tablet, but I was not sure if I buy the Nexus 7 or the Kindle fire HDX. Eventually I went and bought this device and I am really happy and satisfied. It can do pretty much everything you need!! You can download missing apps from outside sources, so it is not a big deal. Its performance really great and I have never been disappointed so far, the only problem I noticed that this device missing a navigation apps and Google maps doesn't work as expected on it! Beside this issue, the Kindle fire HDX is flawless!

Reviews.Title: Simply AWESOME display. Super THIN. WOW!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: William Mutschler "Copper Moose"
Reviews.Content: I debated heavily over this, putting it on my one and only thing for Christmas. I wanted to see the performance and size of this, including thin-ness. The color and clarity are simply stunningly fantastic -- better than any other tablet that I've seen. The FAA discount day enabled me to get it at 15% off, enabling me to afford the 64 GB  (my other spec wish-feature), even though I had to use my debit card because…….the day before. I had bought a reconditioned 8.9" Kindle HD, with 32 gb the day before with Amazon Card, but haven't opened it, knowing that this would be here a day later.My kids have filled their Kindles with game crap, but I wanted the extra space to have more books downloaded at the same time, and more space for movies, music and 'future expansion space.'One might laugh, but as a comics fan I read the volume collections. A little small for my old eyes, so I'm sort of forced to use panel view. But, for USA Today, the smallest text size was just perfect. That is an auto format site, and works great.Finally, my OWN Kindle. I had been sharing one used by my son, but now, no more swapping. No drained battery for dear old dad.I don't see a speed difference yet (I'm not a gamer), but this thing is THIN. I'm hoping to get longer battery life with a smaller screen.The only thing so far is that I am adjusting to a smaller Kindle, having been using the 8.9 HD.

Reviews.Title: That Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Z. McMenemy
Reviews.Content: I love it. I went for the slow dumb first gen Kindle to this power house it is amazing love it

Reviews.Title: I would buy another one!
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE my new Kindle. I have wanted one for about a year so when I heard this new one came out, I definitely wanted one. The resolution is awesome, everything is very quick, I've even resorted to just watching Netflix with the Kindle instead of my TV. The apps/books download very quick and the battery life is awesome on it. The only gripe I will say I have is the fact that you can't change the opening background of it. The picture doesn't bother me but it would of been nice to be able to use my own picture instead of the one they gave. I can't wait to take this to the beach and be able to read my books and not worry! I would recommend this to anybody!

Reviews.Title: A great product!  A definite must have.
Reviews.Author: Cano85
Reviews.Content: Love it!  Does just what I want it to do.  Sharp pics and fast.  A definite recommend.I've been waiting for over a year to purchase one and then the new HDX came out so I'm glad I waited.

Reviews.Title: Worth the upgrade
Reviews.Author: Darren A. Wallace "babysealclubber"
Reviews.Content: My wife loves it. I also have a kindle fire HD, and when I compared watching HD movies side by side there was a visible difference between the HDX and HD. The added 64 GB HD is awesome, my wife can now keep pictures, and she uses it for a lot of things. All in all, I really like the kindle, it's not too big, and not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: Apple, you better watch out.....The Kindle Fire is checking it twice!!
Reviews.Author: Brian Jones
Reviews.Content: I am a Apple fan from the ipod, to ipad, Iphone to Macbook Pro.  I have always felt that every tablet device paled in comparison the the Apple suite of products.  I was wrong.  After using for only a few days I was impressed.  The graphics are amazing (resolution and pixel density). The brightness is also better than the new iPad Air.I also like the new Mayday feature.  Seriously, Apple really dropped it on this feature.  Amazon definitely put the consumers first by allowing a live video chat user like directly to customer service.  They can solve problems easily by taking over your device to make fixes.It has a great battery life and it is super fast.  I give high recommendations for the Kindle Fire.  Apple, you better watch out......

Reviews.Title: A very good tablet
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet a little over a week.  I enjoy it more as I use it more.  I used MayDay on the first day.  It worked as advertised. I was questioning about an App that I had on the Kindle Fire HD that is not compatible to the HDX.  I was told that APPS will be worked to take advantage of the higher quality display.  That seemed to be a reasonable answer.Even though I had the Fire HD, I never used the Silk browser much at all.  I am now familiarizing myself with this browser and that is going well.  I do have a slight bluish haze on the page as I read, but I do not find it distracting.  I viewed part of an episode  of a TV  program I bought through Amazon and the picture and sound were excellent.The weight makes this tablet easy to hold.  Unless I am sitting at my desk and propping up the HDX, I will normally remove it from the Oragami case.  The case works well when I need it, though.I have the HDX chiefly because I like Immersion Reading.  It performs excellently at this task.  And the light weight makes it easy to listen/read at night.  Sound quality is excellent also.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
Reviews.Author: Jenniferab
Reviews.Content: Needs 10 stars!!!  OMG I am in love with this thing!  The first thing that literally blew me away was the sound quality.  Just amazing!  I had the original Kindle Fire and the sound quality really wasn't all that great.  When I got this thing going I literally jumped in my seat because I was surprised at how loud it was.  It's much better than any laptop I've ever had.  It's a very deep, rich sound.  Just phenomenal. Second, was the ability to download prime instant videos. This is great because I got the Wi-Fi version and I take a long bus ride to get to school and can just sit and chill with a good tv show.  Third, I love the immersion reading and if I don't have the audiobook I can choose for it to be read to me.  It sounds a little choppy and robotish with the read-to-me but it's still great if I don't want to sit with my eyes glued to the machine.  The video quality is great.  I personally can't really tell that much of a difference between the Kindle Fire HDX and the original Kindle Fire but that's just me.  I'm sure my friends would tell me there is a huge difference.  Overall, I am very very please with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Not a Great Effort...
Reviews.Author: lucidDream
Reviews.Content: I received my Kindle Fire HDX 7" yesterday. I've owned nearly every generation of the standard Amazon Kindle and use the Kindle App on my iPhone (and on my wife's iPad). I thought about getting an iPad for myself, but I was just looking for a backlit device to read Kindle books on with text-to-speech. The grad-school text book I'm reading on Survey Methods is pretty dry and I was hoping to listen to it in the car (it's not available on Audible). The latest Kindle Paperwhite doesn't support text-to-speech so I went with the Kindle Fire HDX.The first thing I tried to read was a course handout (PDF). The font-scaling on the PDF document was blocky, inconsistent, and difficult to read. This wasn't the case on the iPad, even on the iPad mini without a retina display. With low lighting in the room it was hard to ignore the uneven backlighting towards the edges (dark and/or purple fringing on all four edges).I switched over to the Kindle and went to read through an actual Kindle Store purchase. I reversed the colors (white text on black background) to make the screen easier on my eyes and make the backlighting issues less pronounced. There was immediately noticeable color-shifting on the white text towards purple. I tried to ignore it and kept reading. I went to try out text-to-speech in the middle of an all-text chapter and it wouldn't play. I turned the page and tried again and it played fine. There doesn't seem to be any logic as to which pages will/wont support text-to-speech.Pros:More feature rich Kindle app than the iOS versionText-to-speechCons:PDFs don't scale wellScreen backlighting near edges (I've never seen a backlit display where the issue was this pronounced)White-text color-shiftingWith the above issues I can't recommend this as a Kindle device. If you're looking for a tablet this is really only an iPad alternative if 1) You can tolerate the display issues and 2) You don't mind using an OS designed to be a reading device first and general-use tablet second. I would almost call this a secondary tablet device.

Reviews.Title: Love this tablet
Reviews.Author: Reflections
Reviews.Content: Perfect tablet for me since I travel a lot, need have a tablet that is light and compact, with huge amount content that can be loaded for the time on the road. Downloaded 3 movies from Prime, 1080P quality, it's amazing. Love this thing.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Excellence in Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Safety Mike "Safety Mike"
Reviews.Content: excellent product, fits my hands perfectly, ports located in comfortable position while holding device,  very easy set up right out of the box,  quick and easy set up with my Amazon account, customer service was superb.  Very happy to have chosen Kindle Fire HDX and the screen is incredible.  Very well done Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX Wow, Very Nice Indeed
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: Love it. Buttons are much better than last iteration and can be found by feel easily. Sound, like KFHD, is great. The display is awesome and the difference in speed is remarkable. I have had all three generations of Kindle Fire and will most likely keep buying as they continue to improve. BUT, I have been happy with each one.  Just as Apple lovers say you couldn't give them a Kindle Fire, you couldn't give me an iPad. Both are great products but appeal to different people. I did keep my original Kindle Paperwhite rather than upgrading but may jump on the next one depending on the specs. I think the idea of the May Day button is great but I haven't used it. Since I'm on my third Fire I've just not run into anything I need help with yet. If I do need help I'll be glad it's there. Everyone's experience is never the same so I feel for those who have had problems. But this I know, Amazon will make it right.

Reviews.Title: Good Enough
Reviews.Author: Fred Dempster "FAD"
Reviews.Content: Really like the new FIRE HDX 32GB. Good enough means I would expect to pay a lot more for perfect. Yes there is a bit of blue if you push the video, do not see on movies, and I use my Kindle PW for reading. The new origami case is cool, used last night watching a movie as I handed out Halloween candy. Still learning some of the less used features as I go.
